name: 2 Icing recipes
directions: Cream Cheese Icing
In a mixing bowl, beat the top 4 ingredients together until they're light and fluffy.
Add food coloring or leave it white.
Simple Poured Icing
Mix Powder Sugar and enough lemon juice to form a thin glaze.
Add food coloring or don't.

name: 3 Ingredient Banana Hacks
directions: Pancakes: Mash bananas and then stir in eggs and cinnamon. Heat some oil in a pan and pour a ladle of the mixture to form rounds. Brown on both sides.
Muffins: Mash bananas and then stir in the eggs. Lightly grease a muffin tin and drop blueberries into each well. Cover with the mixture and bake at 350F for about 15 minutes.
Cookies: Mash bananas well, and then stir in oats and raisins. Bake at 350F for 15 minutes.

name: 4 Dipping Sauces
directions: Simply mix the three ingredients together and serve with fries or chicken nuggets.

name: 7-UP Jello Salad
ingredients: 1 large can crushed pineapple, drained (save the juice)
directions: Mix jello and water.
Let cool in refrigerator for 1/2 hour. Chilled not set.
Add: the 7-UP, bananas, marshmallows, and crushed pineapple.
Mix everything into the jello.
While jello is setting, Prepare topping.
Using the remaining ingredients, Heat juice, flour, sugar and egg until thickened.
Cool and add whipped cream.
Spread on jello.

name: Agua Fresca
directions: Blend all ingredients together. Pass through a fine mesh strainer and transfer to a pitcher. Chill in the fridge. Serve with ice.

name: Apple Balsamic Chicken
ingredients: 4 Bone-in chicken thighs (about 1.5 lbs), skin removed
directions: 1. In a small bowl, combine the first nine ingredients. Place chicken in a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker. Pour broth mixture over meat. Lock lid and make sure the vent is closed. Select manual setting, set pressure to high, and set time for 10 minutes.
When finished cooking, allow pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes, then quick-release any remaining pressure according o manufacturer's directions.

2. Remove chicken and keep warm. Skim fat from cooking liquid. In a small saucepan, melt butter and whisk in flour until smooth. Gradually add cooking liquid. Cook and stir until sauce is thickened (2-3 minutes). Serve with chicken.
notes:
Prep: 15 min.
Cook: 15 min + releasing

name: Apple Crisp
directions: Put apples in buttered 9" pan.
Mix brown sugar and flour.
Cut in butter.
Stir in oats.
Spread over apples.
Bake 350 for 35-40 min.

name: Apple Dip
directions: Mix all of the cream cheese with how ever much of the caramel sauce tastes good.
Add caramel to taste.
Add more caramel as topping to the dip.
Cut up an apple and eat with the dip!

name: Apple Pie
ingredients: 9 apples peeled, cored and sliced (no seeds)
directions: Peel apples, cut out the core (including seeds, seed husks, etc.) and slice.
Put in Pie Crust and cover with thin rolled out dough.
Cover the edges of the pie with tin foil for the first 25 minutes to prevent over browning.
Bake at 375 for 25 minutes with the foil on.
Take the foil off and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack.

name: Apple Salad
directions: Dissolve jello in water then add remaining ingredients.
Set in a ring mold and fill center with tinted whipped cream and sliced bananas.

name: Bacon and Cheddar Potatoes
directions: Cut the potatoes in a canoe shape.
Place the potatoes in a greased baking dish with olive oil and bake at 200 degrees for 30-40 minutes.
Arrange the potatoes on a plate and cover with warm cheddar.
Place crispy diced bacon on top.
notes: Check temperature F or C

name: Bacon and Eggs Bowls
directions: Fry the bacon in a pan set to medium heat until crispy. Transfer to a paper towel lined pan to absorb excess oil. Set aside. Whisk the eggs, milk, salt, pepper and nutmeg in a bowl. For extra flavor, you can add any herb or seasoning of your choice.

Slice the tops off the buns and remove the bread from the center, creating bowls. Place the bowls on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil. Evenly distribute the bacon and cheese between the bread bowls, then pour the egg mixture on top.
Bake at 320F for 30-40 min, until the egg has set and is lightly browned. Remove from oven and enjoy.

name: Baked Chicken Breasts
directions: Place slice of Swiss cheese on top of each chicken breast.
Sprinkle Stove Top stuffing crumbs on top.
Mix cream of chicken soup with spice packet from Stove Top mix.
Spread on top of stuffing crumbs.
Dab with half cube of butter.
Cover baking dish with foil.
Bake at 350 degrees for an hour.

name: Baked Chicken Breasts
directions: Place a slice of Swiss cheese on top of each chicken breast.
Sprinkle Stove Top Stuffing crumbs on top.
Mix cream of chicken soup with spice packet from Stove Top mix.
Spread on top of stuffing crumbs.
Dab with half cube of butter.
Cover baking dish with foil.
Bake a 350 degrees for 1 hour.

name: Baked Onion Cheese Rings
ingredients: 1 Slice mozzarella cheese, cut into strips
1 Slice cheddar cheese, cut into strips
directions: Put potato chips in a Ziploc bag and crush until they are like crumbs.
Slice the onion into 1/2 inch thickness and separate the rings.
Arrange cheese strips inside the onion rings. Repeat, alternating with the mozzarella and cheddar cheese.
Dip the onion rings in flour to coat them. Then dip them in the beaten egg.
Thoroughly coat the rings in potato chip crumbs.
Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees.
Enjoy with tomato sauce or ketchup.

name: Baked Tomato and Egg cups
ingredients: 3 Roma tomatoes, halved and seeded (look for larger Roma tomatoes)
directions: Preheat oven to 450º
Place tomatoes on a baking sheet. You might need to slice a tiny bit off the bottom of each tomato to keep them level on the pan.
Crack eggs and gently place in the cavity of each tomato.
Season with salt and pepper. I added dried red pepper flakes for a little heat.
Bake for 6-7 minutes if you like your eggs runny. 8-10 for soft set.
Remove from oven and top with fresh chopped herbs.
Serve as is or on top of a crusty piece of toasted bread. This is also wonderful stuffed into a toasted bagel.

name: Balsamic Vinegar Noodles
directions: Cook the Rotini noodles.
Add cheese, vinegar, salt, pepper, and tomatoes.
Mix until noodles are a medium brown.
notes: The picture represents the choice to use lettuce instead of pasta.

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Bread
ingredients: 5 ripe bananas, 4 mashed and 1 coarsely chopped
directions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add vanilla, lemon juice and eggs, beating well.
Stir in mashed bananas.
Sift together salt, flour, baking soda and baking powder.
Combine with banana mixture.
Add sour cream, (nuts), and coarsely chopped banana.
Turn into 2 greased loaf pans or 7 small loaf pans.
(Top with more chopped nuts.)
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours or 1 hour for small pans or until surface springs back when touched.
Cool in pan.
notes: 1/2 cup nuts (optional)

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Bars
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a large bowl, beat brown sugar and butter until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg, salt and bananas until well combined. Stir in oats, chocolate chips and Craisins and mix thoroughly.
Spread evenly in prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely, then cut into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, greased

name: Banana Cream Pie
directions: Poke the bottom the pie crust with a fork.
back at 375 for 25 minutes.
Slice bananas and place in the bottom of the pie crust.
Spread Jell-O over the bananas.

name: Banana Crush
directions: Combine sugar and water.
Cook to a syrup.
Remove from heat and add remaining ingredients.
Let cool.
Pour into ice cube trays and freeze.
To serve, put 2-3 ice cubes into a glass and fill with 7 UP.
notes:
Great for parties
Ice cube trays needed

name: Banana Granola Drops
directions: Preheat oven to 375 F
In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
In a large bowl, beat butter and brown sugar until smooth and creamy. Add egg, vanilla and bananas and beat until well blended. Add flour mixture and mix well. Stir in granola.
Drop by tablespoonfuls, about 2 inches apart, onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 12 minutes or until golden brown.
Immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

name: Banana Nutella Ice Cream
directions: Peel and slice bananas and put in storage.
Place in freezer for 3 hours or until frozen.
Place bananas and Nutella in food processor and run until contents are smooth and blended.
Can be served like soft serve now or transferred to loaf an and place in freezer for 2 hours to get normal ice cream texture.
notes: Rather than Nutella, add raspberries or other fruits.

name: Banana Quick Bread
directions: preheat oven to 350 F.
Cream the sugar and butter in a large mixing bowl until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beat well after each addition.
Ina small bowl, mash the bananas with a fork.
Mix in the milk and cinnamon.
In another bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Add the banana mixture to the creamed mixture and stir until combined.
Add dry ingredients, mixing just until flour disappears.
Pour batter into paper lined muffin pans and bake 15-20 minutes, until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

name: Banana Split Cupcakes
directions: Preheat your oven to 355F or 320F for a fan forced oven.
In the bowl of a stand mixer fitter with the paddle attachment, add the flour, baking powder, caster sugar and salt. Turn mixer on low speed and allow it to mix well.
Add the softened butter and let it mix until it resembles a fine sand like texture.
Next, add milk, eggs, yogurt, yellow food dye, oil and vanilla extract in a large bowl and whisk well.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients in a slow and steady stream. Scrape down the bowl, add mashed banana, and mix for another 20 seconds.
Fill each cupcake line 3/4 of the way. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Allow them to cool completely before frosting.

To finish off the cupcakes, core the center and fill with chocolate sauce. Fit the end of your piping tip with a 1M tip and frost the cupcakes in a swirl motion. Drizzle chocolate sauce over the top. Sprinkle with crushed peanuts and top with a cherry.
notes:
Frosting - Vanilla Buttercream Frosting
Cake - Recipe can be used for 8" cake tin - adjust baking time to 30-40 minutes.

name: Bar-B-Que Meat Loaf
directions: Mix beef, crumbs, onion, egg, salt, pepper and 1/2 can tomato sauce; form into a loaf.
Combine rest of tomato sauce and all other ingredients.
Stir and pour over loaf.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Baste occasionally.

name: Basic Crepes
directions: Measure all ingredients in to a bowl with a whisk until smooth.
Season crepe pan with a little butter, margarine, or oil.
On low to medium heat.
Spread a thin layer of crepe batter over the pan.
Cook without browning on both sides, roll over your filling of choice.

name: Birthday Cake Popcorn
ingredients: 6 Tbsp Popcorn kernels, un-popped (6 to 8 cups popped)
directions: Pop popcorn in an air popper, or in a microwave using a paper bag, 3 tablespoons at a time. Transfer to a large bowl.

Melt chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl for 30 second intervals (stirring each time) until melted. Add vegetable mix to the chocolate/shortening mixture and stir then add the sprinkles and stir again.
Pour the warm chocolate mixture over the popcorn, and stir until evenly coated. Use your hands, get messy.
Pour the popcorn onto a baking sheet line with wax paper to harden at room temperature.

name: Black Forest Brownie Cups
ingredients: 1 Package Fudge Brownie Mix, Duncan Hines
directions: Preheat oven to 350.
Spray muffin tins with non stick cooking spray (1 3/4 inch muffin cups.
In a large bowl, stir together brownie mix, butter cut into pieces, and egg. (Mixture should be thick.)
Scoop 1 Tbsp. of the brownie mixture into the muffin tins.
Push the mixture up on the side to make the bowl.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and chill in the refrigerator for 5 minutes or until the middle sinks a bit.
Fill each sunken center with 2 tsp. of Cherry Pie Filling.
Bake for 15-17 minutes or until a toothpick comes out almost completely clean.
top with whipped cream and a sprinkle of Cocoa Powder.
notes: Try topping with ice cream after cooking for 20 minutes instead of Cherry filling.

name: Blueberry Freezer Jam
directions: Blueberries, sugar and lemon juice in saucepan.
Simmer over low heat.
Mash fruit.
Stir in pectin.
Pour in jars and leave a 1/2 inch at the top/
Boil water and then put jars in for 10+ to seal the tops.

name: Blueberry Jam recipe
directions: Bring blueberries and water to a boil.
Mash and stir for 5 minutes.
Add sugar and honey.
Boil uncovered for 30 minutes on medium heat.
Pour in jars leaving 1/4 inch at the top.
Boil water and put jars in for 10+ min. to seal them.

name: Blueberry Jello Salad
ingredients: 2 small packages of black cherry jello
directions: Thoroughly dissolve jello and boiling water.
Add blueberries and pineapple, juice and all.
Let partially set.
add 1/2 of Cool whip and mix well.
Pour in bowl or pan and cover with remaining Cool whip.
(Sprinkle nuts on top.)
Return to the refrigerator until completely set.
notes: 1/2 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

name: Blueberry Smoothies
directions: Put milk, juice and blueberries into a blender. Blend for about 30 seconds.
Then add the Greek yogurt and honey. Blend well.
Either serve it as a smoothie or turn it into Popsicles.

name: Braided Cheesy Garlic Bread
ingredients: 1 Head of garlic, peeled and minced
directions: In a bowl, combine warm milk, yeast, and sugar. Once the mixture becomes foamy, gradually mix in the flour and salt. Knead the dough into a smooth ball. Cover and allow the dough to rise for 1 hour in a warm spot.
Meanwhile, make the filling: combine all ingredients in a owl, except the mozzarella. Set aside.

Preheat oven to 350F. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to form a rectangle. Spread the filling over the dough and make sure to leave an inch around the edges. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the top.
Roll the dough into a log lengthwise. Slice the roll in half lengthwise leaving one end (about 1 inch) intact. Twist the two sides into a braid, while trying to keep the cut sides facing up.
Grease a loaf pan and place the braided dough inside. Cover and allow to rise again for about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Uncover, brush with olive oil, and bake for about 30-35 minutes.

name: Bread Sticks
directions: Melt butter in 9x10 inch pan.
In a bowl, dissolve yeast in water, stir in honey.
Mix salt and flour; stir into water mixture.
Knead dough for 10 minutes.
Roll into a rectangle the size of the pan.
Sprinkle with garlic salt or onion salt or sesame seeds and Parmesan cheese.
Let rise for 15 minutes.
Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes.

name: Bread Sticks
directions: In the bowl of a stand mixer, add water, sugar, and yeast. allow to,stand for 5 minutes, or until yeast bubbles up.

Add flour, salt, olive oil, and remaining water to yeast mixture. Using the dough hook attachment, mix until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl to form a ball. If the mixture is too wet, add a Tbsp of flour at a time until this happens.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap or towel, and allow to rest in a warm place until dough doubles in volume (approx. 1.5 hours).
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.

Divide dough in two, and then cut into eight pieces. Using your hands roll each piece into a cylinder. Using a sharp paring knife, cut the dough into eight equal 10" bread sticks. Gently shape the dough so that they look like bread sticks, and transfer to a lined baking sheet coated in cooking spray. Make sure to slightly space them apart.
Bake for 7-8 minutes, until just slightly golden.
Melt butter with salt and garlic powder. Brush over warm bread sticks, and top with a generous sprinkling of Parmesan cheese.

name: Breadsticks
directions: In the bowl of a stand mixer, add water, sugar, and yeast. Allow to stand for 5 minutes, or until yeast bubbles up.

Add flour, salt, olive oil, and remaining water to yeast mixture. Using the dough hook attachment, mix until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl to form a ball. If the mixture is too wet, add a Tbsp of flour at a time.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap or towel, and allow to rest in a warm place until dough doubles in volume (approx. 1.5 hours).
Preheat oven to 425F.

Divide dough into two, and then cut into eight pieces. Using your hands roll each piece into a cylinder. Using a sharp paring knife, cut the dough so that they look like bread sticks, and transfer to a lined baking sheet coated in cooking spray. Make sure to slightly space them apart.
Bake for 7-8 minutes, until just slightly golden.
Melt butter with salt and garlic powder. Brush over warm bread sticks, and top with a generous sprinkling of Parmesan cheese.

name: Breakfast Ramekins
directions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Layer the bottom of your ramekin with prosciutto. Toss a handful of halved cherry tomatoes, add an egg and season with pepper and grated Parmesan.
Bake for 10-15 minutes, depending on how well-done you like your egg yolks.
Garnish with more grated Parmesan and chopped chives.

name: Broccoli Cheese Soup
ingredients: 1/2 Ibs fresh broccoli florets or a 12 oz. bag of frozen broccoli
directions: Saute onion in Tbsp butter until translucent; set aside.
Cook 1/4 cup butter and flour using a whisk over medium heat for 3-5 minutes.
Stir constantly and add half and half.
Add chicken broth; simmer for 20 minutes.
Add broccoli, carrots and onions.
Cook over low heat 20-25 minutes, or until broccoli is tender.
Put portions into blender and puree until smooth.
Retur to heat; add cheese and season.
notes: cook time 1 hour

name: Butter Ball Cookies
directions: Mix all ingredients.
Roll into walnut size balls.
Bake for 15-18 minutes at 350 degrees.
Cool on wire racks.
Sprinkle with sifted powdered sugar.
notes: 1 cup walnuts, chopped

name: Butter Cream / Chocolate Frosting
directions: In a mixing bowl beat butter till fluffy. Gradually add 2 cups of powdered sugar. beat well.
Slowly beat in the 1/4 cup of milk and vanilla.
Slowly beat in remaining powdered sugar.
Beat in additional milk, if needed, to reach spreading consistency.
If desired, tint with food coloring.
notes:
For chocolate frosting...
beat 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder to butter.
Reduce powdered sugar to 4 cups.

name: Cafe Rio Rice
directions: In sauce pan, combine rice, butter, garlic 1 tsp. lime, chicken broth and water.
Bring to a boil.
Cover and cook on low for 15-20 minutes, until rice is tender.
Remove from heat.
In a small bowl combine lime juice, sugar and cilantro.
Pour over hot cooked rice and mix in as you fluff the rice.

name: Candied Orange Peels
ingredients: 1 cup Granulated sugar, plus more for coating
directions: Boil a pot of water. Thoroughly wash the oranges to get rid of any waxy residue.
Slice off both ends, and then follow the curve of the oranges to slice off the peel. Try to keep most of the pith intact.
Slice off any remaining fruit flesh, and slice lengthwise into strips. Add the peels to the water and soften for at least 5 minutes. Drain and set aside on a rack.
In a saucepan, combine water and sugar. Stir until dissolved and then heat to boil. Once boiling, add the peels and reduce to a simmer.
Allow the syrup to thicken, about 20-25 minutes.
Remove peels and spread evenly across a cooling rack. allow to dry for at least 2 hours. You can speed dry them in the oven at the lowest temperature until the peels feel slightly tacky.
Coat the peels in sugar, and allow to dry or serve right away.

name: Caramel Candy Brownies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.

Filling: in a microwave – safe bowl, on medium power, heat caramels and milk for 3 minutes. Remove from oven and stir until melted and smooth. (Alternatively, heat caramels and milk in a saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth and melted.) Keep warm while preparing brownie batter.

Base and topping: in a large sauce pan, over low heat, melt chocolate and butter, stirring constantly, until smooth. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. When mixture has cooled, stir in sugar. Add eggs and beat until just blended. Stir in milk. Blend in flour. Stir in nuts.

Spread half the batter evenly and prepared pan. Spoon filling over batter. Sprinkle 3/4 cups of the nuts over top. Drop remaining batter by spoonfuls over nuts, then sprinkle with remaining nuts. Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely, then cut into squares.
notes: 9-inch square cake pan, greased

name: Caramel Oatmeal Bars
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups Milk or sweetened condensed milk
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Base: in a large bowl, mix together flour, brown sugar and oats. Using two knives, a pastry blender or your fingers, cut butter in until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.

Add egg and mix until blended. Stir in pecans. Set aside 1 1/2 cups and press remainder evenly into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 15 to 18 minutes or until lightly browned. Place pan on rack to cool slightly.

Topping: In a sauce pan, over low heat, melt caramels with milk, stirring constantly until smooth. Pour over baked base. Sprinkle reserved crumb mixture evenly over top. Bake 20 to 25 minutes longer, until bubbly and golden brown. Place pan on a rack to cool completely, then cut into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, greased

name: Caramel Peanut Cup Bars
ingredients: 1 container of ready to serve chocolate frosting
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.

Base: in a large bowl, mix together cake mix, butter and egg, until smooth. Fold and peanut butter cups. Spread mixture evenly in prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Place pan on a wire rack to cool slightly.

Topping: in a sauce pan, over low heat, stir together caramel sauce, corn starch and peanut butter. Increase heat and bring to a boil; cook, stirring constantly, for two minutes, until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/2 cup of the peanuts and spread evenly over warm base.
Bake 6 to 8 minutes longer or until almost set. Place pan on a rack to cool completely. Spread frosting over top. Sprinkle with remaining peanuts. Chill at least one hour before cutting into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, greased

name: Caramels
directions: Combine sugar and syrup.
Bring to a boil and add butter.
Add milk, a little at a time.
Continue cooking slowly so boiling never ceases, stirring constantly.
Boil to firm ball stage, 242 degrees.
Add vanilla (and pour over nuts which have been scattered at the bottom of a well oiled cookie sheet.)
Let stand several hours.
Turn out onto wax paper and cut into squares.
Wrap in wax paper.
notes: 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

name: Challah Scarf
directions: Combine the water and a pinch of the sugar in a bowl. Sprinkle the yeast over top and set aside until foamy (5-6 min). Add the remaining sugar, honey, butter, egg yolks and 2 of the whole eggs and using an electric mixer, beat to combine. Add half the flour and the salt and mix at a low speed until smooth. Add remaining flour and combine. Pour onto a floured surface and knead by hand until the dough is smooth and elastic, 8 minutes. Place the dough into an oiled bowl and cover the top with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm draft free place until doubled in size, 1.5 hours.

Remove the dough from the bowl and cut off a small amount for the fringe of the scarf, set aside. Using a scale, begin to cut 9 even pieces measuring each piece and adding/removing dough as needed. Once you have divided the dough evenly, roll each piece into a thin snake roughly 20 inches in length. Connect all nine strands at the top of your board by pinching then together.

To braid, start with the most right strand and place over the 2 left adjacent strands. Then take the same strand under the next 2 left adjacent strands. Do the same with the left most strand. Repeat the process and a braid will soon appear.
Once finished, tuck all the strands together and decorate with remaining dough creating the fringe and seams. Cover loosely with a tea towel and let rise for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350F. Whisk remaining egg and brush the loaf. Bake for 35-40 minutes covering with foil after 30 minutes to prevent over browning. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.

name: Cheese and Potato Soup
directions: Heat oil in heavy large saucepan over medium heat.
Add celery, carrot, onion and thyme and saute until vegetables begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle flour over and stir 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in broth, then milk.
Add potato and bring soup to boil.
Reduce heat and simmer soup until potato is tender, and 20 minutes.
Add cheese 1/3 cup at a time, stirring until melted and smooth after each addition. Mix in ham
Season soup to taste with Tabasco, salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

name: Cheese Ball
ingredients: 2 small pkg. chipped beef (lunch meat thin sliced)
2 Tbsp. chives or chopped green onions
directions: Chop up the beef into little squares.
Mix all ingredients together except 1 package of chopped beef.
Shape into 2 balls and roll in remaining chipped beef.
Refrigerate until set.

name: Cheese Sauce
directions: Melt butter.
Whisk in flour and cook on medium for 2-3 minutes.
Whisk in milk and bring to a boil stirring constantly.
Once boiling, reduce temperature to a simmer and simmer fro 10 minutes stirring occasionally.
Remove sauce from heat and whisk in cheese and season with salt and pepper.

name: Cheesecake Swirl Brownies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Filling: in a small bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg until incorporated. Set aside.
Base and Topping:In a large bowl, mix together flour, cocoa, sugar and baking powder. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts.

In another small bowl, whisk together oil, applesauce, milk, vanilla and egg until well blended. Add to flour mixture and mix until combined. Reserve one cup of mixture for topping and spread remainder evenly and prepared pan. Spread cream cheese filling evenly over batter. Drop reserved batter, by spoonfuls, over filling.

Run a knife through the batter at 1-inch intervals across the width of the pan, to create a marbling effect. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes or until a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely, then cut into squares.
notes: 8-inch square cake pan, greased

name: Cheesy Rotini and Tuna
directions: Cook pasta as directed on package.
Mix remaining ingredients in microwavable safe 2-qt bowl.
Microwave on high 3-4 minutes or until heated through, stirring after 2 minutes.
Drain pasta and mix with tuna mixture.
notes: Broccoli can be substituted with other vegetables.

name: Cherry Vanilla Ice Cream
ingredients: 2 cups Sour cherries (from a jar), strained
directions: Place the whipping cream and 1 cup of cherries in a small pot and set to medium heat. Once the cream begins to simmer, remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature. strain to separate the cream and cherries. Whip the whipping cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Then place the cream in the fridge.

In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and add the sugar, vanilla and cherry extract. Beat well with an electric mixer until the mixture forms a ribbon when the whisk is lifted and the ribbon remains on the surface of the mixture for a few seconds. Add half of the egg mixture to the cream, and whisk together.

Once they are fully combined, add the remaining egg mixture and gently fold the mixture together and combine.  Add the soaked cherries and additional 1 cup of cherries and fold to combine. Make sure to be gentle and keep the mixture as airy as possible.
Pour the ice cream into a Tupperware container, and seal with the lid. Place this in the freezer for 7-8 hours to chill and set.

name: Cherry-Almond Oatmeal
directions: In a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker coated with cooking spray, combine first 6 ingredients. Lock lid; make sure vent is closed. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high and set time for 12 minutes.
When finished cooking, allow pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes; quick-release any remaining pressure according to manufacturer's instructions. Serve with additional almond milk if desired.

name: Chicken Cacciatore
directions: Cut chicken into serving size pieces.
Put chicken and onions into crockpot.
Mix the rest of the ingredients together and pour over chicken.
Cover and cook on low 7-9 hours or on high for 3-4 hours.
Remove bay leaf.
Serve with noodles as a topping.

name: Chicken Divan
ingredients: 3 chicken breasts ( or 2 cans cooked chicken)
directions: Mix chicken soup, mayonnaise, and lemon juice for sauce.
Layer broccoli and chicken in a 9 x 13" dish.
Pour sauce over broccoli and chicken.
Cover with grated cheddar cheese.
Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes
Serve over minute rice.
notes: Delicious and filling!

name: Chicken Fajitas
ingredients: 1 cup each, green, yellow, and red pepper strips
directions: Combine corn starch, chili powder, salt, paprika, sugar, chicken bouillon cube, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and cumin.
Add 1 cup of water and put in saucepan to heat.
Add chicken strips and mix well. Cook until chicken is done and water evaporates to just a nice sauce. While cooking, add more water if needed. Set aside.
Place flour tortillas in tin foil and seal. put in preheated 350 degree oven  for about 10 minutes. Turn heat off but do not remove or unwrap tortillas until you are ready to serve them.
Coat bottom of frying pan with olive oil and add onions and peppers. Cook till tender to the bite.

Add onions and peppers to chicken mixture and heat thoroughly. When hot, take flour tortillas and put chicken and vegetables in the middle of the tortilla. Fold both sides over the middle and serve with sour cream on top.
notes: Make sure chicken is cooked well and not pink inside.

name: Chicken Nuggets
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Spread panko across a baking sheet and bake for a few minutes until golden. Set aside to cool.
In a food processor, add chicken ingredients and blend until the mixture becomes a pasta and set aside.

Prep the dredge station: flour in one dish, eggs in another dish, and panko, fine bread crumbs, Parmesan, salt, pepper, and butter combined in another dish. Scoop about 2 tablespoons of chicken and form into nuggets.
Heat the oven to 450 degrees. Coat each nugget in flour, then dip into eggs, and into the crumbs.
Place on a wire rack and bake or about 15-20 minutes or until crispy and cooked in the center.
Mix the sauce ingredients together and eat!

name: Chicken Roll-ups
directions: Saute the onion, celery and mushrooms in small amount of butter.
Add to 4 Tbsp. butter, pepper, cream cheese and chicken.
Roll the rolls thinner than normal and fill with 1/4 cup filling.
Fold and dip in the melted butter.
Roll in bread crumbs and bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
Make a gravy with chicken broth and cream of chicken soup to serve other rolls.

name: Chicken Salad Sandwiches
directions: Cook the chicken for 10-15 minutes.
Mix ingredients together and chill for several hours.
Fills 4 dozen dollar rolls.
notes: almonds are optional

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken (cut into strips)
directions: In 1g. skillet stir-fry chicken in oil on medium heat for 5 minutes.
Add vegetables, soy sauce and seasoning; stir-fry for 5 minutes, until chicken is done.

name: Chimichangas
directions: Brown hamburger, and drain fat.
Add next five ingredients and mix well.
Take off burner.
Heat oil in frying pan- 1/2 inch deep in frying pan- on medium- High.
Put 1/4 cup hamburger mixture on tortilla.
Fold and fry until light brown on both sides.
Top of with lettuce, tomatoes, and sour cream.

name: Chocolate Banana Mini Pies
ingredients: 1/2 cup Dark semi-sweet chocolate, finely chopped
1/4 cup Dark semi-sweet chocolate, for drizzling on top
directions: Place bananas, vanilla and peanut butter in a food processor and puree until they reach a creamy texture. Add 1/2 cup chopped chocolate and mix one more time.
Scoop mixture into individual pie crusts and freeze for at least 2 hours.
When ready to serve, place reserved 1/4 cup chocolate in a glass bowl and microwave until melted.
Plate each pie and drizzle melted chocolate on top of each one. Serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Banana Popsicles
ingredients: 2 Tbsp Vanilla yogurt, plus extra for filling
directions: In a food processor blend the bananas, cocoa, yogurt, oatmeal and chia seeds until smooth and ice cream-like, in a separate small bowl add a handful of berries and crush with a fork.
To assemble, layer the banana mixture into Popsicle molds coming half way to the top. Tap on the counter to ensure this layer is level and doesn't have air bubbles.
Layer the berries in each mold and then finish with any remaining vanilla yogurt. Stick the Popsicle stick into the center of each mold and freeze for 2 hours.

name: Chocolate Crater Cupcakes
ingredients: 1 package (19.5 ounces) dark chocolate cake mix, Duncan Hines
directions: Preheat oven to 350.
If you want, mix 1 cup of sweetened shredded coconut with 1 cup of chopped walnuts and spoon about 1 Tbsp of the mixture into the bottom of the tins.
In a large mixing bowl, beat cake mix, chocolate mix, oil, eggs with an electric mixer on low for 30 seconds.
Scrape the sides and beat for 2 minutes on medium.
spoon mixture into the tins half full.
In a medium mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and butter with an electronic mixer on low until well mixed.
Add powdered sugar and beat until smooth.
Spoon cream cheese mixture onto the batter.
Sprinkle cream cheese mixture in each cup with 1/2 teaspoon of the miniature chocolate chips.
Bake for 20-24 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the centers of the cake part comes out clean.
Cool for 5 minutes.

name: Chocolate Frosting
directions: Melt butter, cocoa and water and bring t a boil.
Remove from heat and add powdered sugar.
Add vanilla extract.
Frost cake when the cake is cool.
notes: For Chocolate Sheet Cake

name: Chocolate Lava Cookies
ingredients: 1/2 cup Sugar, plus 1/2 cup for dusting
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat.
In a medium bowl, combine lour, cocoa powder, salt and baking soda. Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together shortening and sugars with a hand-held mixer. Add eggs one at a time, and stir in vanilla. Add dry ingredients and mix until combined.

Scoop approximately 1/4 cup of dough in your hand and flatten. Pour approximately 1/2 tsp of hot fudge sauce in the center and wrap dough around it to form a ball. Repeat steps until all dough is used.
Toss dough balls in sugar and bake for 6 to 8 minutes until set. Cool cookies on a rack and serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Orange Cake
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place oranges in a pot, cover with water, bring to a boil and allow to simmer for 1-1 1/2 hours, until fork tender. Cool, cut open and remove pips/seeds if any.
Place oranges in a food processor and puree until pulpy. Add remaining ingredients, and blitz until completely incorporated.
Grease a square pie pan with butter, and line with parchment paper. Pour batter into pan, and place in oven for 50-60 minutes, or until middle of cake is firm to the touch.
Allow to cool to room temperature before un-molding.
Place ingredients for glaze in a heat-proof bowl over a saucepan of barely simmering water. Stir until completely melted.
Pour over cake, and garnish with orange zest.

name: Chocolate Sheet Cake
ingredients: 1/2 cup buttermilk OR 1/2 cup milk and 1 tsp. vinegar
directions: Mix flour and sugar together in a bowl.
In a sauce pan, bring butter, water and cocoa to a boil.
Pour the mixture into the flour and sugar.
Add eggs, cinnamon, butter milk, baking soda, vanilla extract.
Beat until smooth and pour into ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 400 for 20 minutes.
pour on Chocolate Frosting. (next page for recipe.)
notes: bake in cookie sheet pan.

name: Chocolate Shell
directions: Combine and put on top of ice cream.
notes: Put on ice cream or dip inch sized banana ice cream balls into chocolate and refreeze.

name: Chocolate Truffle Pie Filling
directions: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Cook empty pie crust for 15 minutes.
Cut butter in slices and melt in a sauce pan with chocolate.
When smooth, remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix everything else.
When the chocolate has cooled, mix into the previous mixture and pour it into the the pie crust.
Bake pie for 30-35 minutes.

name: Chocolate-Dipped Chips
directions: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate in 15 second intervals, while stirring in between. Di[ each chip halfway and place on a tray, lined with parchment or Silpat. While wet, sprinkle the chocolate with chili flakes. Allow to harden.
notes: Movie Night Snacks

name: Chocolate-Drizzled Peanut Butter Bars
ingredients: 24 Miniature peanut butter cups, cut into quarters
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking powder and salt.

In a large bowl, beat sugars, butter and peanut butter until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until incorporated. Stir in vanilla. Blend in flour and sugar. Stir in peanuts. Spread evenly in prepared pan.

Sprinkle pieces of peanut butter cups over batter and press down slightly. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until tester inserted in the center of cake comes out clean. Allow to cool slightly.

Chocolate drizzle: in the top of a double boiler, over hot (not boiling) water, milk chocolate chips with butter, stirring until smooth. Drizzle over top of warm cake. Cool completely, then cut into bars.
notes: 13x9 inch cake pan, lightly greased

name: Cilantro Jalapeno sauce
ingredients: 2 cups loosely packed Cilantro, stems removed
directions: Combine jalapenos, cilantro, sour cream, garlic, lime juice, and salt in a food processor.
While the motor is running, slowly pour in the olive oil and viengar in a steady stream.
Once it's all combined, serve with chicken or fries.

name: Cinnamon Filling
directions: In a bowl mix all the ingredients together.
Add filling to a piping bad and set aside.
Use this to create the cinnamon roll swirl in the pancakes.

name: Cinnamon French Toast Bites
ingredients: 4 Thick slices of slightly stale white bread (1" cubes)
directions: Cut the crust off the bread, then cut each piece into equal 1" cubes.
Whisk the eggs, milk and salt in a medium bowl.
Combine sugar and cinnamon in a shallow bowl.
Melt 1/2 Tbsp of butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
Quickly toss half of the bread cubes into the egg mixture and use your hands to shake off the excess egg mixture.
Place the bread cubes in the frying pan and use a wooden spoon to "saute" them until browned on all sides -  about 2 to 3 minutes.
Remove the cubes from the frying pan straight into the sugar mixture. Toss to coat, then remove and place on a plate.
Serve immediately with maple syrup for dipping.

name: Cinnamon Muffins
directions: Mix all ingredients.
Grease muffin tins at the bottom only (or use cupcake papers.)
Place enough mixture in tin to cover bottom only.
Put a dab of your favorite jam in the middle.
Cover with mixture to fill tin.
May sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar mixture.
Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.

name: Cinnamon Pretzels
directions: Mix the yeast with the warm water, and leave to sit for 5 minutes.
Add the two flours, brown sugar and salt to a bowl, and slowly pour in the yeast mixture and knead for 5 minutes until you have a soft dough.
Put the dough in a bowl and let rise for 30 minutes.
Once the dough is risen, knock the air out and split into 12 chunks. Roll the the chunks of dough into long ropes and twist together to make a pretzel shape. Lay them on a baking tray until complete.
Boil the water and baking soda together and dip each pretzel into the solution, dry with a towel then place them back on the baking sheet.
Bake at 400-450 degrees for 10 minutes.
Once cooked, melt the butter and mix the cinnamon and sugar together in a separate bowl.
Coat the cooked pretzel in butter and then dip them in the sugar mixture and serve.

name: Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
directions: In a bowl, whisk flour, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, beat milk, oil, and egg together.
Add wet ingredients into flour mixture. Whisk until batter is combined.

Heat large skillet on medium heat. Spray with nonstick spray. Scoop 1/4 cup batter onto skillet and cook for 2 minutes. Squeeze piping bag filling into a spiral patter on pancake. Let sit for 2 minutes; when bubbles begin to appear, flip with a thin spatula, and cook for another minute. Transfer to plate and drizzle cream cheese glaze on top.

name: Cinnamon Rolls
directions: In a small bowl, dissolve yeast and a pinch of sugar in warm water and set aside.
In a large bowl mix milk, sugar, melted butter, salt and egg.
Add 2 cups of flour and mix until smooth.
Add yeast mixture ad remaining flour.
Mix on medium speed with dough hook for 2 minutes or until dough is easy to handle.
Roll out on a floured surface into a 15 x 9 rectangle.
Spread melted butter all over dough.
Mix sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over buttered dough.
Roll beginning at the 15 inch side and cut into 12 to 15 pieces.
Bake until golden brown about 12-15 minutes.
notes: heat oven to 350 degrees

name: Citrus Vinaigrette
directions: Combine the orange and lime juices, basil, cilantro, salt, pepper, honey, and oil in a blender and blend for 1 minute.

name: Clay
directions: Boil water.
Add to dry ingredients and knead.
To keep soft, store in zip-lock bags.

name: Confetti Calamari
ingredients: 1 cup All-purpose flour, plus more if needed
directions: Heat fryer to 360 F.
Blot and dry the calamari with paper towels.

Cut the tubes open by sliding your knife up the inside and cut outward. Unfold the flat piece the long way and cut into thin strips. For the tentacles cut off the stingers, the cut the tentacles in half the long way to make two symmetrical pieces.

To a large Ziploc bag, add approximately 1 cup flour, 1-2 tablespoons paprika, and salt. Add the calamari to the bag, and zip the bag 90% across. Blow air into the opening to make the bag puff out, and zip it shut. Now shake, shake, shake. Pour the calamari into the colander with a bowl underneath to remove the excess flour.
Drop the calamari into the fryer and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown.
Make lemon zest mayo by combining lemon zest and mayo in a small bowl.
Transfer calamari to a mixing bowl. Add salt and toss. Sever with lemon zest mayo.

name: Conga Bars
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Lightly grease 13x9x2 inch baking pan.
With mixer on medium speed, beat butter, and brown sugar in a large bowl until well blended.
Add eggs, one at a time.
On low speed better gradually beat in flour, salt and baking soda.
Add vanilla.
Spread mixture evenly in prepared pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until wooden toothpick comes out of center clean.
notes: 1/4 c. Chopped nuts (optional)

name: Continental Chicken
ingredients: 1 can of cream of mushroom soup
directions: Arrange dried beef slices on botto of crock pot.
Wrap each piece of chicken with a slice of bacon.
Place on top of the beef.
Mix everything else and pour into crockpot.
Cover and cook for 7-9 on low or 3-4 hours on high.
serve with noodles or mashed potatos as a topping.

name: Cookies and Cream Cheesecake Donuts
directions: To make white choc ganache simply add the chocolate and cream to a large microwave safe bowl and microwave for 20 seconds at a time, mixing each time until it becomes a smooth mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to cool.

While the donuts are cooling prepare the cheesecake filling by adding the cream cheese and sugar or sweetened condensed milk to a large mixing bowl. use a wooden spoon to combine them or a hand mixer until the mixture is smooth. Transfer to a zip lock bag or piping bag.

To finish off the donuts simply poke a hole in the top of the donut and insert the bag with cheesecake filling in the donut. Fill with filling. Once all the donuts are filled carefully dip them in the white choc ganache.
notes: Use with Doughnut Recipe

name: Cream Cheese Chicken
directions: Turn crock pot on High. Place butter in bottom of crockpot.
When butter has melted, add one envelope Italian dressing dry mix. Stir into butter until well mixed.
Cut chicken breasts into 1" strips. Place in crock pot and stir to coat chicken in butter and dressing mix.
Cover and cook on high for 2 hours.
Remove chicken to plate to cool.
Add 1 can cream of chicken soup and cream cheese.
Stir to melt and mix well until smooth and creamy.
Remove sauce from crock pot and pour on chicken.
notes: Can be served on top of mashed potatoes, rice, or hot buttered noodles.

name: Cream Cheese Chocolate Chips Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a small saucepan, over very low heat, melt 1 cup chocolate chips.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour and baking soda.

In a large bowl, beat butter, cream cheese and sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg until well incorporated. Beat in melted chocolate until well combined. Add flour mixture and mix well. Fold in nuts and remaining chocolate chips.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake in oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until cookies are firm around the edges. Transfer to wire rack to let cool.

name: Cream Cheese Glaze
directions: In a bowl add butter and cream cheese. Microwave for 30 seconds. Add powdered sugar and vanilla extract and whisk until smooth.
Drizzle on top of completed pancakes.

name: Cream Puff Filling and Chocolate Sauce
directions: In a saucepan, Mix sugar, corn starch and salt.
Gradually stir in milk.
Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and boils.
Boil and stir for 1 minute.
Place eggs in a different bowl.
In a custard cup, place vanilla and butter.
After it boils for 1 minute, slowly pour half of the egg mixture into the pan.
Pour the rest of the egg mixture in and boil for 1 minute.
Take off heat and add butter and vanilla.
Frosting: Heat 1 square unsweetened chocolate and 1 tsp. Butter until melted. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup of sifted confectioner's sugar and about 2 tbsp. hot water. Beat until smooth.
notes:
1 square unsweetened chocolate
1 cup sugar
2 Tbsp. hot water

name: Cream Puffs
directions: Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees
place parchment paper on cookie sheet
In saucepan, heat water and butter to a rolling boil.
Remove pan from burner
Slowly add flour and stir until completely combined (mixture will be lumpy)
Put pan bake on heat and stir quickly until mixture forms a ball and film appears at the bottom of the pan.
Take off and quickly beat in the eggs until the mixture is smooth and thick
Place mixture on pan and form 6 mounds.
Bake for 35 minutes and until puffed and golden brown and dry.
Add cream filling and Chocolate frosting
notes: Cream filling and Chocolate frosting are separate recipes

name: Creamy Blue Cheese Dip
ingredients: 5 oz. Danish blue cheese, finely crumbled
directions: In a food processor or blender, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, blue cheese and cayenne pepper. Process until smooth. Transfer to a serving dish. Sprinkle with the green onions.
Cover and refrigerate until serving time.
The dip can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days.

name: Crepes
directions: Combine flour, milk, egg and salt.
Spray 6-inch skillet with nonstick spray.
Preheat skillet.
Then remove from heat.
Pour 2 Tbsp. of batter in center of pan, lift and tilt skillet to spread batter.
Return to heat.
Brown on one side only- invert skillet over paper towel; remove crepe.
notes: can be filled with eggs, fruit, etc.

name: Crispy Potato Skins
directions: Preheat oven to 400F.
Prick the potatoes with a fork in several places. Wrap in foil and bake until tender, about 50 minutes. Cool slightly before handling.

With a sharp knife, cut the potatoes into quarters. Scoop out the inside, leaving 1/4 inch shell. Reserve the filling for another use. Brush the skins with oil. Place cut side up on a baking sheet. Bake about 15 minutes, or until crisp.
Remove from the oven. Sprinkle with the garlic powder and Parmesan. Return to the oven for 2 minutes to melt the cheese.

name: Crockpot Balsamic Glazed Drumsticks
ingredients: 3 Tbsp coconut oil (olive oil would work too)
directions: Put all ingredients into a ziploc bag.
Either freeze for a make ahead meal or let marinade overnight.
The next morning just dump it all in the crockpot and cook on low for 6-8 hours.

name: Darcy's Cheese Bread
directions: Place warm water in mixer with yeast. stir to combine. Wait to add next ingredients until  you see bubbling.
Add salt and flour.
Knead for 8 minutes.
Let rise in greased bowl for 1 hour or until doubled.
Turn out on flat surface. Roll into a rectangle. Divide into two equal parts. Spread the cheese on each section and roll tightly. Cover both loaves.
Let rise for about 45 minutes.
Heat oven to 425
Spritz bread dough with water and slice openings in the top.
Bake for 30 minutes rotating once.
Place on cooling rack.

name: Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups
directions: Melt the chocolate and half of the coconut oil on a double boiler.
Once smooth, turn off the heat and leave it on the pot.
Mix the peanut butter with the remaining coconut oil.
Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.
Fill with enough chocolate to cover the bottom and put in the freezer for 5 minutes.
Once set add a scoop of the peanut butter and spread out with the back of a spoon.
Cover with more chocolate to cover the peanut butter completely.
Put in the freezer for 25-30 minutes.

name: Deep Dish Chocolate Chip Cookie
ingredients: 1 cup semi-sweet or dark chocolate chips
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degree.
Soften the 9 tablespoons butter in the microwave for 30 seconds or until partially melted. Soften the remaining 8 tablespoons for 10 seconds.
Mix the butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until creamed. Add the vanilla and maple syrup and mix again until smooth. Add the eggs; beat slowly until incorporated.

Add the flour, baking soda, and salt (sometimes it helps to add the flour in batches). Mix until a smooth, dry dough forms. Stir in the chocolate chips and chocolate chunks. Melt the caramel pieces and heavy cream in the microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well until melted and smooth.

Press half of the dough mixture into a 9-inch or larger cast iron skillet lined with parchment paper. Pour the caramel over the dough and smooth with a spoon. Cover with another layer of cookie dough. Bake for 15-25 minutes (see notes). Remove from oven, sprinkle with sea salt, and allow to rest for at least one hour in order for the pieces to hold their shape when cut.
notes: I baked mine uncovered for 15 minutes, but you could also cover with foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes to get the cookie center baked even further. If you only bake for 15 minutes total, like I did, the cookie WILL be underbaked.

name: Dole Whip
directions: Place all ingredients in a blender, and blend until smooth.
Serve in a cold glass, garnish with an umbrella or a cherry and enjoy!

name: Donuts
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups All-purpose flour (add more as needed)
directions: In the bowl of an electric stand mixer, whisk together yeast, warm water and 1/2 tsp of the sugar. Cover it with cling wrap and a towel. Let it rest 5-10 minutes in a warm spot until it becomes frothy.
Add in milk, remaining granulated sugar (3 Tbsp + 2 1/2 tsp), salt, 1/4 cup Shortening, egg, egg yolk and vanilla.

Add half of the flour and set mixer with whisk attachment and blend until smooth. Switch mixer to hook attachment, slowly add remaining flour and knead on low speed until smooth and elastic about 4-5 minutes, adding additional flour as needed (about 2 Tbsp more. Should be slightly tacky and sticky). Transfer dough to a lightly oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until double in size, about 1 1/2 hours.

Punch dough down and roll into an even layer onto a floured surface to slightly less than 1/2 inch thickness. Cut into doughnut shapes using a 3 inch cookie cutter. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30-40 minutes.

Preheat the oil in a large pot on medium high heat. Drop a small amount of dough into the oil and if it bubbles and fizzes around the sides the oil is hot enough. Gently and carefully drop donuts into the oil. Don't add more than three donuts at a time. Cook them on one side until they're a light brown then flip them over. Once they're golden on both sides carefully take them out and transfer them to a plate lined with kitchen paper towels to let the oil drain.
Poke hole in middle and fill with filling.
Best served the same day they're made.

name: Double Chocolate and Toffee Cookies
directions: preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Combine all dry ingredients.
Add butter and egg.
Roll into one inch balls and bake for 8-10 minutes.

name: Drop Biscuits
ingredients: 2 cups All-purpose flour, spooned and leveled
1/2 cup Cold unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
directions: Heat oven to 400 F.
In a bowl, combine the flour, butter, baking powder, and salt; and cut using pastry cutter or fork until pea-size clumps form.
Add the milk and mix until moistened.
Drop large mounds of dough onto a baking sheet. Bake until golden, 10-15 minutes.

name: Easy Chicken and Broccoli
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into chunks
directions: Spray frying pan with cooking spray.
Add chicken.
Cook and stir on medium- high heat for 2-3 minutes or until brown.
Add broccoli, soup, and water.
Bring to boil and stir.
Stir in rice and sprinkle with cheese.
Cover and reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes.

name: Easy Chocolate Cookies
directions: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees
Mix all ingredients together
Bake on an ungreased pan for 10 minutes
notes:
12 per Pan
Ungreased Pan
Betty Crockers devil's food cake mix works the best

name: Easy Chocolate Suffle
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
In a large bowl, melt chocolate and butter. Add vanilla and whisk in yolks one at a time until smooth. Set aside.
In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with sugar, salt and cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. fold egg whites into chocolate.
Grease ramekins with butter and dust unsweetened cocoa and tap out excess. Spoon batter into ramekins.
Bake until puffed and set, approximately 20 minutes. Serve with powdered sugar.

name: Easy Elephant Ears
directions: Preheat oven to 425 F.
Sprinkle a pastry board with a thick layer of sugar. Place puff pastry on top and roll into a neat oblong.

Fold one long side of puff pastry inward, like a jellyroll, but stopping at the center. Repeat on the other side, so the two rolls meet in the center. Cut into slice 1/4 inch thick and press each slice in sugar.
Place slices on cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 6 to 8 minutes. Turn over and bake for another 6 to 8 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Edible Peanut Butter Cup Cookie Dough
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
1/2 cup Mini peanut butter cups, halved
directions: In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the peanut butter and sugar on medium speed until fluffy and light in color. beat in vanilla until incorporated and set aside.

In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in chocolate chips, peanut butter cups and Reese's Piece's. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve alone or dipped in chocolate as a truffle.

name: Edible Rocky Road Cookie Dough
ingredients: 3/4 cup All-purpose flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
directions: Melt 1 cup of the chocolate chips in a double-boiler until smooth. Remove from the heat, and let cool to room temperature.

Using a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the granulated sugar on medium speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in vanilla until incorporated and set aside.

In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the melted chocolate, followed by the dry ingredients, to the creamed butter using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in marshmallows, nuts, and salted caramel sauce until just combined.. refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve alone or chill and use to make ice cream sandwiches.

name: Edible Sugar Cookie Dough
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
directions: In a large bowl using a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the granulated sugar and vanilla on medium speed until fluffy and light in color.

In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in rainbow sprinkles. refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve a scoop of chilled cookie dough on a sugar cone and enjoy.

name: Edible Triple Chip Cookie Dough
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups All-purpose flour, heated for 1 minute in microwave
directions: In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter for about 1 minute on medium-high speed. Once smooth, add the sugar on medium-high speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in vanilla until incorporated and set aside.

In a separate medium-size bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and baking powder. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients using a cup measure or large spoon. Once combined, fold in all three chocolate chips. refrigerate for 1 hour before serving for best results.
Serve alone or form into small 1/2 inch balls for an ice cream topping.

name: Everyone's favorite no-bake cookies
directions: place oats, peanut butter and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Set aside.
Combine sugar, milk, cocoa and butter in a large saucepan.
Bring to a boil; boil 1 minute (no longer)
Remove from heat. Pour over oat mixture.
Stir well.
Drop onto wax paper and let cool.
notes: boil the mixture 1 minute - no more, no less

name: Fancy Mac and Cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 355 F.
Heat a large frying pan over medium heat, add the olive oil and pancetta. Fry until browned and crispy, about 8 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the cottage cheese, ricotta, Dijon, cayenne, nutmeg and good seasoning. Tip into a large bowl and add the cheddar, Parmesan and milk, stirring to combine.

Mix through the dried macaroni then tip into a large ovenproof dish. Top with the crispy pancetta and a sprinkling of Parmesan cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil, baking another 30 minutes. Remove and allow to cool slightly.

name: Fast Mac and Cheese
directions: Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon butter and the shallots. Saute until fragrant. Add elbow pasta and 1/2 cup of chicken stock. When the stock is evaporated, check the doneness of the pasta. If it needs to cook longer, ad the other 1/2 cup of chicken stock.
Once the pasta is fully cooked, add the shredded cheddar and fontina.
Once the cheese is melted and incorporated, add 1/2 tablespoon butter and the cream to finish. Top with chives.

name: Florentine Potatoes
ingredients: 6 cloves Garlic, crushed in their skins
directions: Set oven to 400F. Cut the fingerlings into equal but misshapen 1-inch pieces. Soak them in water for at least an hour.
Add the potatoes, crushed garlic, sage, olive oil, salt and red pepper flakes to a large bowl and toss to coat.
Transfer all of that to a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes then mix potatoes around. Return to oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.

name: Forgotten cookies
directions: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees
Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper
Separate the 2 eggs (discard the yolks)
Put egg whites into medium bowl and add tartar
use electric mixer, beat egg whites and tartar until foamy stage
Add sugar and beat until stiff peak stage
Fold in Krispy rice cereal and Chocolate Chips
Using a spoon, drop one spoonful per cookie on to cookie tray
Put cookie tray into oven and immediately turn off the oven
"Forget" until the oven has cooled and cookies have hardened.

name: French Toast
directions: Mix all ingredients into bowl.
Dip bread into bowl covering both sides of the bread with the mix.
Put on to griddle.
Flip over when one side is cooked.
Cook at 250 to 200 degrees.

name: Fried Chicken
directions: Mix flour, onion powder and garlic salt in bowl.
In another bowl, mix eggs and water.
Cut chicken pieces and put in a bowl.
Dip chicken first in flour, then eggs, then bread crumbs.
Put dipped chicken into the oil which is in a frying pan.
Flip over when one side is done.
Cook chicken and make sure there is no pink in the middle.
notes: Put in how ever much you feel you need to make flavorful

name: Fried Mozzarella Sticks
directions: Cut the mozzarella cheese into 1/4 inch sticks.

In a small bowl, beat together the eggs, salt and pepper. Combine the bread crumbs, parsley and Parmesan cheese in a shallow bowl. Dip the cheese sticks into the egg mixture, then roll them in the bread crumbs. Press the crumbs firmly onto the cheese sticks. Place them on a platter until you're ready to fry them.
Heat 1/2 inch vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook the cheese sticks for 3 minutes on both sides, or until they're golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
The mozzarella sticks can be reheated in a 350F oven for 7 minutes.

name: Fried Scones
directions: Knead 20 times.
Raise for ten minutes.
Roll 1/2 inch thick, cut and deep fry.
notes: If using Saf instant yeast, add to flour mixture and add water to milk after scalded.

name: Frozen Berry Pops
ingredients: 1 cup Vanilla Yogurt (Greek Style Yogurt works well)
3-5 Tbsp. Honey or Agave to taste
directions: Puree the berries.
Add vanilla yogurt, lemon juice and honey until smooth.
Divide mixture into freezer-pop molds stopping about 1 inch from the top.
Freeze until firm, about 6 hours.
Dip molds briefly in hot water to make it easier to take them out of their containers.

name: Frozen Chocolate Covered Bananas
ingredients: 1/2 cup semi-sweet or dark chocolate chips
directions: melt the chocolate and oil together until warm and liquidy.
chop bananas into 1/2 inch slices.
Dip and submerge bananas carefully and set out on wax paper and freeze.
If using peanut butter, cut banana slices in half and put peanut butter in between.
Then cover in chocolate.

name: Fruit Jello Slices
ingredients: (If making watermelon slices, Use mini chocolate chips)
directions: Cut fruit in half.
Clean out with spoon until there is only the rind left.
Make Box of jello.
Lay rinds in the muffin tin and pour jello into rinds.
Chill until firm.
(If making watermelon slices, Push mini chocolate chips in with skewer.)
notes:
Spoon
Skewer
Muffin tin

name: Fusilli Alla Caprese
directions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water. Drain pasta.
In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes, salt and pepper. As the tomatoes cook and soften, mash them gently with the back of a fork. Continue to cook until the tomatoes make a chunky sauce, about 4 minutes.
Add the tomato sauce to the cooked pasta, and add the basil and mozzarella. Stir to combine.
Add the reserve pasta water, 1/4 cup at a time until the pasta is moist. Serve immediately.

name: Garlic Alfredo Mac and Cheese
directions: In a skillet, melt the butter with olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic, cream, pepper and bring mixture to a simmer stirring often. Add the Parmesan cheese and simmer sauce for 10-15 minutes or until sauce has thickened and is smooth.
Add in the cooked and drained macaroni as well as the mozzarella. Stir to evenly coat. top with bread crumbs and place in the oven on broil until the top has become crisp. Enjoy!

name: Garlic Edamame
directions: Cook edamame in lightly salted boiling water until tender. Strain and season with garlic powder and more salt, if desired.
notes: Movie Night Snacks

name: German Chocolate Cake Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a large bowl, cream butter until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until incorporated. Mix in cake mix and flour.

Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 2 inches apart, onto prepared cookie sheet. Press a cherry half into the top of each cookie. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

name: Giant Cinnamon Roll
ingredients: 2 1/4 Cups all-purpose flour, plus 1/2 cup if needed
directions: In the bowl of a stand mixer, add 2 1/4 cups flour, sugar, salt and instant yeast. Mix until evenly distributed.

Melt the butter and combine with the water and milk. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and mix. Add the egg. Knead the dough on medium  until it starts pulling from the sides of the bowl, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the additional flour if dough is too wet.
Remove the dough from the bowl and place in a lightly greased bowl. Cover tightly and let rest for 30 minutes in a warm place.
While the dough is resting, gather the ingredients for the filling. Mix together the cinnamon and sugar and melt the butter.
On a lightly floured surface roll out the dough into a 12x15 rectangle. Using a pastry brush, brush the dough with butter and sprinkle with the cinnamon sugar.
Using a pizza cutter, cut the dough into six, 2-inch-wide strips. Roll one of the strips to create a cinnamon roll. use the other strips to keep spiraling the main roll until you form a giant roll.
Spray a 9-inch cake pan with nonstick spray. carefully transfer the giant roll into the cake pan. Loosely cover and let rise for another 30 to 60 minutes in a warm place.
After it's doubled in size, bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned. While the roll is baking, whisk together the ingredients for the icing.
Once the roll has come out of the oven, allow it to cool until warm and spread with the icing. Serve warm.
notes:
Active Time: 2 hours
Total Time: 3 hours

name: Glaze
directions: Cream together butter and powdered sugar.
Add vanilla and hot water to desired consistency.

name: Grandma's Beef Stew
directions: Put all ingredients in a crockpot.
Stir.
Cover and cook for 10-12 hours on low or 5-6 hours on high.

name: Green Bean Casserole
directions: Drain the green beans.
Mix everything except cheese together.
Put in 9 x 13 pan.
Cover the top in cheese.
Bake 30 min. at 375 degrees.

name: Grilled Hasselback Baguette
directions: Preheat oven or grill to 350 F.
Begin by melting the butter in a small sauce pot. Grate in 3 cloves of garlic and cook until fragrant and butter has fully melted. Remove from heat.
Cut the break on a slight bias about 3/4 of the way down, making sure the bottom of the bread stays connected. Do this with both loaves and set aside.
Next, slice the mozzarella block in half, and then slice into thin pieces, about 1/4 inch thick. Set aside.
Slice the tomatoes the same as the cheese, about 1/4 inch thick rounds.
To assemble, alternate a slice of cheese with a slice of tomato in the sliced baguettes. Add a little piece of prosciutto in with every cheese slice.

Place each baguette on a piece of aluminum foil. Roll up the sides around the bread, so it acts like a boat to catch everything. Sprinkle both baguettes with salt and pepper and finish by drizzling the garlic butter evenly over.
Place on the grill or in the oven and cook for 10-12 minutes or until the cheese has melted, the bread has toasted and prosciutto has gotten a little crispy. Serve immediately.

name: Guiltless Alfredo Sauce
ingredients: 1/3 cup (3 oz.) Low fat cream cheese
directions: In a blender, blend the milk and cream cheese, flour, and salt until smooth and set aside.
In large bowl saucepan, melt butter on medium-high heat and add the garlic.
Saute for about 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Add milk mixture. Stir constantly for 3-4 minutes or until it just starts to simmer.
Keep cooking and stirring a few more minutes until thickened.
Once thickened, remove from heat and whisk cheese in.
Cover and let stand 10 minutes before serving over pasta.
notes: 10 minutes before serving (it will get thicker)

name: Hash Brown Casserole
ingredients: 1 large bag of shredded cheddar cheese.
1 can of cream of chicken soup
directions: Placed chopped onion in microwave container with butter and sauté about a minute.
In largest mixing bowl, add hash browns, cheese onions, soup and sour cream.
(If the hash browns are frozen in clumps, unclump them.)
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Mix everything well and place in large 13x9 inch baking pan. You can butter or Pam pan.
Bake at 350 until bubbly and cheese is melted and slightly crispy on sides.

name: Hawaiian Haystack
directions: Combine soup and broth in saucepan to make gravy.
Add chicken and simmer for 8-10 minutes.
On plate layer ingredients: Rice, Gravy, Cheese, other toppings, Salt, and Pepper.
notes: Toppings are optional

name: Heat and Sweet Beignets
directions: In a large bowl add the yeast and the warm water and allow it to bloom, once there are active bubbles add the sugar, salt, eggs, and milk and blend well.
Add 4 cups and blend until smooth, finally add the rest of the flour and the shortening, cover and chill of 12 hours.
Roll out dough, cut and fry, serve hot with a light sprinkle of cayenne pepper and a ton of powdered sugar.

name: Herb and Goat Cheese Baked Egg Boats
directions: Preheat oven to 350F.
Cut out long oval section from the top 1/4 section of the baguette. Scoop out the inside bread and discard.
Place on sheet tray making sure it sits flat.
In a bowl combine the eggs, cream and a pinch of salt and pepper. Whisk together. Next add in the chives, parsley, and basil. Stir to combine. Add lemon vest.
Stuff the arugula into the hollowed out bread. Next pour in the egg mixture. Then crumble over the goat cheese, pressing it down into the mixture. Lastly drizzle with a little olive oil.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and eggs are set.
Slice and Serve

name: Homemade Fries
directions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch matchsticks. Place on a baking pan lined with parchment paper and toss with salt, pepper and olive oil.
Spread out potatoes evenly and bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown and fully cooked.

name: Homemade Play-Dough
ingredients: A Few Drops of Food Coloring
directions: Put all the ingredients into a saucepan on medium heat.
Stir constantly.
When in begins to come together into a ball, its done.
notes:
Clay recipe in book 1.
Burgerville recipe.
In need of a great milkshake??
Go to Burgerville for a chocolate monkey milkshake.

name: Homemade Tortillas
directions: In a large bowl, combine flour and salt. stir in water and oil.
Turn onto a floured surface; knead 10-12 times, adding a little flour or water if needed to achieve a smooth dough. Let rest for 10 minutes.
Divide dough into eight portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a 7-inch. Circle.
In a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray, cook tortillas over medium heat for 1 minute on each side or until lightly browned. Keep warm.

name: Honey Barbequed Ribs
directions: Put the ribs in the crockpot.
Cover and cook on high for 3 hours.
Drain.
Reduce heat from high to low.
Mix the remaining ingredients in a bowl.
Pour over ribs in the crockpot.
Cover and cook on low for 3 hours.

name: Honey Strawberry Ice Cream
directions: Combine all ice cream ingredients except strawerries in a bowl. Refrigerate for an hour before pouring the mixture into the ice cream maker.
Place the whole strawberries on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Drizzle balsamic vinegar over top and put them under the broiler for 1 minute.
When the ice cream starts to form, add the diced strawberries to the mixture.
Serve the ice cream with the warm strawberries over top.

name: Honeydew Sorbet
directions: Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the cubed honeydew onto the baking sheet, leaving space in between the cubes to allow for even freezing.
Place the tray into the freezer and freeze the honeydew overnight or until fully frozen (4-6 hours).

Place the frozen honeydew into the bowl of a food processor, along with the lemon juice, honey, and water, and pulse until the honeydew becomes crumbly. You may need to add more water until the mixture becomes more fluid, but not slushy. You're looking for a soft sorbet texture at this point.
Taste and add any additional honey mixture as needed at a time.
notes: Lasts for up to 2 weeks

name: Hummus
directions: In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, garlic, lemon juice, sesame seeds and pesto.
Pulse several times until the mixture is coarsely chopped. Add the olive oil, parsley and pepper.
Puree until smooth and creamy. Move into a serving bowl and top with fresh cilantro is desired.

name: Hummus with Fried Chickpeas
ingredients: 1 1/2 - 2 cups Dry chickpeas, soaked overnight with baking soda
(Reserve 1/2 cup soaking water and chickpeas for frying later)
directions: Add chickpeas, 1/2 cup water from soaking chickpeas, tahini, garlic, cumin, water, and salt to a food processor and blend until smooth. Taste frequently to season. Add more tahini or lemon as needed.
Add 1/2 inch oil to high-sided skillet. Add 1/2 cup chickpeas and fry until golden brown. Remove to a plate lined with paper towels and season with cumin.
Add lemon olive oil ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.
Add hummus to a shallow, wide bowl and use a spoon to make a swirl in the hummus. Top with lemon oil and fried chickpeas. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with pita chips.

name: In and Out Monster Sauce
directions: In a medium bowl combine all sauce ingredients, mix well, and set aside.

name: Jello Popcorn
directions: Melt syrup, sugar and jello in sauce pan.
Pour over popped popcorn.

name: Julene's Cinnamon Rolls/Scones
directions: Dissolve yeast in warm water; set aside.
Add sugar, shortening, and salt to scalded milk.
Add flour, egg, and dissolved yeast to milk mixture and mix well. You may need to add additional flour to make soft dough. You do not want stiff dough! Knead well. Let dough rise for 20 min.
Punch down, and let dough rise for 15 minutes more.
Roll dough into rectangle and add filling.
Filling: 2 Tbsp. melted butter. Spread across dough.
2 tsp. ground cinnamon + 1/2 cup sugar. Sprinkle generously across dough.
Roll dough and seal the edge.
Slice with piece of thread and place on buttered pan. Let rise for 20 minutes.
Bake rolls at 400 degrees for 5 minutes.Then bake at 375 degrees for 5-10 minutes until they are golden brown. Let cool slightly.
Frosting: Combine 1 cup powdered sugar, 1/4 tsp. vanilla, 2 Tbsp. softened butter, and enough milk to make a drizzle. You can add a little almond extract too, if you like. Drizzle over warm rolls.
notes: To make scones: Make dough, let rise for 30 minutes, and fry in the "Fry Daddy."

name: Lazy Day Lasagne
ingredients: 1 (15 1/2 oz.) jar spaghetti sauce with meat
directions: Cook noodles in boiling water following package directions.
Drain.
Add oregano to spaghetti sauce.
In greased 10x16x1 1/2 baking dish make layers in this order: noodles, cottage cheese, Mozzarella cheese, spaghetti sauce.
Repeat.
Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Lemon Curd Cake
ingredients: About 3 Tbsp of milk to loosen batter
directions: For the Lemon curd, place the sugar, corn starch and flour 450ml water in a large saucepan and stir until you have a smooth mixture. Stir in the lemon juice, egg yolks and salt. Place over a medium heat and keep stirring while the mixture boils, for about 10-12 minutes. Stir in the lemon zest and butter has melted, then remove the pan from the heat and allow to cool.
Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease and line two 21cm tins.
Cream butter, sugar, and lemon zest together until fluffy and pale. Then beat in the eggs one by one before adding the vanilla extract and lemon juice.
Using a spatula, fold in the flour until you have a smooth mixture. Use a little bit of the milk if you need to loosen the mixture. Should be a little loose.
Divide the mixture into two springform tins, Bake for about 20 minutes, until nice and golden brown. Take then out and let them cool for a few minutes.

While the bases are cooling prepare the buttercream filling by beating the butter and vanilla extract together in a bowl until light and fluffy then add the icing sugar, a little at a time, until it is all incorporated and the mixture is smooth.
assembly: Spread lemon curd on one of the bases before topping with buttercream, then add the second base and sprinkle with icing sugar.

name: Lemon Meringue Pie
directions: poke holes in the pie crust and bake at 375 for 25 minutes.
Separate egg yolks from the whites and set aside.
Mix sugar, flour, cornstarch and a dash of salt.
Gradually stir in water and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly.
Reduce heat and cook for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Beat the egg yolks.
Gradually stir about 1 cup of the hot filling into the yolks.
Pour egg yolk mixture back into the rest of the hot filling.
Bring to a gentle boil then cook for 2 more minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in butter and lemon peel.
Gently stir in lemon juice and keep the filling warm.
Pour warm filling into the crust and spread meringue over it and press into the crust's edges to seal.
Bake at 350 for 15 minutes and cool on a wire rack for 1 hour ad chill for 3-6 hours.

name: Lemon Poppy Seed Scones
directions: Heat oven to 375 degrees.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, lemon zest, poppy seeds, salt and sugar. Mix Well
Cut in butter and shortening.
In a separate bowl, combine cream with beaten egg then add to dry ingredients.
Turn dough out onto a floured surface. Roll dough out and cut into biscuit size rounds.
Brush the top with egg wash and sprinkle some sugar on the top.
Bake for 15 minutes or until brown.
notes: Rather than using lemon zest and poppy seeds, experiment with other flavor combinations.

name: Lemon Red Potatoes
directions: Either poke potatoes with a fork or cut a strip of peel around the middle of each potato. Place potatoes and water in a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker. Lock lid and make sure the vent is closed. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high and set time for 12 minutes. When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to manufacturer's directions. rain any cooking liquid; return potatoes to pressure cooker.
In a small bowl, combine butter, parsley, lemon juice and chives. Pour over the potatoes; toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

name: Lemon Thyme Shortbread Cookies
