directions: Using an electric mixer or stand mixer, beat together butter, sugar, vanilla, and salt until light and fluffy. Stir in the lemon zest and thyme. Mix in flour just until combined.
Divide in half and shape into discs. Wrap each disc in plastic wrap, refrigerate until firm but not hard, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 300F.
Roll out each disc, one at a time, on a floured board to a 1/4 inch. Cut out the cookies using a 2 inch cutter and place on a baking sheet covered with parchment. Repeat with second disc.
Bake until golden, about 20 minutes. Let cool on pans for 10 minutes. Remove them and let them cool completely.

name: Lemon Tomato Penne
ingredients: 1 Tbsp. red pepper flakes, more to taste
directions: Bring a medium-sized pot of salted water to a boil.
Ina saute pan on high heat, add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the sliced onion. stir and add a pinch of salt. Once onions begin to turn brown, add a ladle-full of water from the pasta pot.
Continue to cook down the onions and add water until they are soft and medium brown in color, about 25 minutes.

Once onions are caramelized, add a pinch of red pepper flakes and the tomatoes to the saute pan, lower the heat to medium and simmer. If the sauce looks too thick, add water from the pasta pot to thin out.
Add pasta to the boiling water, and cook 2 minutes less than box instructions.

Once the pasta is cooked, add it to the sauce. Turn the heat to high, add a ladle of pasta water and stir well for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, add the cheese, another ladle-full of water, and stir to combine. Stir in Lemon zest and more water if needed to thin out.
Transfer to a plate and garnish with more cheese, parsley and a splash of olive oil.
notes:
Active Time: 15 min
Total Time: 25 min

name: Lime Dipping Sauce
directions: Combine the sugar and water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Remove from the heat. Stir in the fish sauce and lime juice. Pour into a small bowl. Garnish with a cilantro leaf if desired.
Store for up to 5 days.
notes: Tasty with shrimp or steamed rice

name: Linguini
ingredients: 1 package fresh Linguini or about 8 servings dry linguini-cooked
directions: Sauté onion and garlic. Stir in tomato paste.
Add the Italian-style tomatoes, and simmer for about 20 minutes.
In separate pan, warm half-and-half cream, ***BUT NOT TO A BOIL!!!
Pour half-and-half cream over hot cooked linguini.
Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over linguini and cream; mix together to make sure that cheese sticks to the pasta.
Pour simmering tomato mixture over all. Mix together and serve.

name: Lollipops
directions: Grease inside of molds with shortening.
Place mold on greased flat surface like a flat baking sheet.
Place clips over tabs of molds and insert sucker stick.
Combine sugar, water, and corn syrup.
Cook on medium high heat in sauce pan.
Remove from heat and let cool to 275 degrees.
Add flavoring and food coloring.
Pour into molds.
Allow candy to cool then remove molds from lollipops.
Set lollipops on second flat surface to complete cooling.
notes: Specific flavoring from store

name: Mac and Cheese Donuts
directions: Preheat oven to 350F. Mix cracker crumbs, one tablespoon of melted butter, and 1/2 cup of shredded cheese. Set aside.

Cook macaroni in salted water according to package instructions, until al dente. Drain and return to the pot. Add the remaining melted butter and beaten egg. Stir to coat and cooked macaroni. Then mix in the milk, flour, and the remaining shredded cheese.
Spoon the mixture equally into a greased donut pan. Sprinkle the tops with the cracker crumb and cheese mixture.
Bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown and firm.

name: Mac and Cheese Pasotto
directions: Heat a pan over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon butter and the shallots. Saute until fragrant. Add elbow pasta and the chicken stock; cover.
Toss or stir every 2 minutes for 8 minutes. Remove top and allow stock to reduce.
When the stock is evaporated, check the doneness of the pasta. If it needs to cook longer, add some warm water or more stock.
Once the pasta is fully cooked, add the shredded cheddar and fontina.
Once the cheese is melted and incorporated, add 1/2 tablespoon butter and the cream to finish. Top with chives.

name: Marbled Cream Cheese Squares
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Filling: in a medium bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg until incorporated. Blend in flour. Set aside.
Base: in a sauce pan, over low heat, melt butter and chocolate, stirring until smooth. Set aside to cool slightly.
When mixture has cooled, stir in sugar. Beat in eggs until blended. Stir in milk. Blend in flour. Stir in nuts.

Spread half the batter evenly in prepared pan. Spread filling evenly over base. Spread remaining batter evenly over filling. Run a knife through the layers to create a marbling effect. Bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely and pan, then cut into squares.
notes: 9-inch square cake pan, greased

name: Melon Rainbow Pops
directions: Stir sugar into boiling water and whisk until dissolved. Remove and chill until cold.
Had watermelon, lime juice and 1 to 2 tablespoons simple syrup to the blender and blend until smooth. Fill six popsicle molds or paper cups 1/3 of the way full. Pop into the freezer for 40 minutes.
Rinse out blender and add honeydew, 1 to 2 tablespoons simple syrup, and lemon juice. Blend until smooth. Add to container to chill.
Rinse out blender once more and blend cantaloupe, grapefruit juice, and 1 to 2 tablespoons simple syrup. Remove to a container to chill.
After the watermelon a semi – firm, add honeydew to the mold. Place in freezer for 40 more minutes, then top with the cantaloupe. Place in freezer until completely firm, another four hours.

name: Mike's chocolate Peanut Butter Milkshake
directions: Put all of the ingredients into the blender.
Blend on max until thoroughly mixed and smooth.

name: Milk Chocolate Peanut Butter Creme Brulee
ingredients: 1/4 cup Smooth peanut butter, such as jif
directions: Bring the heavy cream and milk to a simmer in a medium saucepan over medium heat, remove from the stove, and stir in the peanuts. Let sit, covered, for at least 1 hour. Strain the mixture, wipe out the pan and return the mixer to the pan.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.

Place the mixture back on the stove, add 1/4 cup of the granulated sugar, and bring to a simmer, stirring until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from the heat and whisk in the chocolate and peanut butter. Whisk together the yolks, the remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugar, and the salt in a large bowl until pale color.
Slowly whisk in the hot chocolate mixture and continue whisking until combined. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl.

Place four 8-ounce ramekins inside a large baking dish and using a ladle, divide the mixture evenly among the ramekins. Pour hot water into the dish until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake until the custard will continue to cook as it cools. Let cool to room temperature, then cover each ramekin with plastic wrap and refrigerator until cold, at least 4 hours and up to 24 hours.
Preheat the broiler until very hot.

Sprinkle an even coat of the turbinado or raw sugar over each custard, place the ramekins on a baking sheet, and broil until the sugar is melted and dark golden brown, about 2 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve immediately.

name: Minestrone
directions: Place all ingredients except zucchini in crock pot
cover and cook on low 10 to 16 hours or on high 4 to 6 hours.
Add zucchini during last hour of cooking.
Remove from crock pot and let cool until serving.

name: Mini Chocolate Fudge Cream pies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 24-cup mini muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray and set aside.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugar until well combined. Add the flour and salt and mix until a ball of dough forms.

Divide dough into 24 (2 tsp sized) balls and press each one into the bottom and up the sides of each greased muffin cup. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and press the crust back into the pan with the tip of your finger or the back of a small spoon. Return to the oven for 6-8 minutes longer or until the crusts are just starting to turn brown. Remove from the oven and let cool.

Ina large microwavable bowl, melt the chocolate adn milk on medium power in 30-second intervals until completely melted. Let cool for about 10 minutes. Stir in the vanilla and then fold in 1-1/2 cups of the thawed whipping topping.
Scoop a few teaspoons of the fudge filling into each pie crust until full.
Serve with whipped topping and chocolate shavings on top or store covered with plastic wrap in the refridgerator. (let sit for 15 minutes after removing from the fridge.)

name: Mini Cinnamon Rolls
directions: Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees.
On floured baking sheet, roll out biscuit until thin as a pancake.
Spread butter on top.
Mix cinnamon and sugar in a bowl.
Sprinkle the mixture onto the roll. Roll it into long snake shape.
Pinch the edges and cut dough into tiny slices.
Bake rolls for 8 minutes.
Mix water and powdered sugar in bowl until smooth.
Dip the tops of baked cinnamon rolls into the frosting.
notes:
Rolling Pin
Small bowls
Kitchen Scissors
Baking sheet

name: Mini Croissants
directions: Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees.
Roll triangle out to be as thin as a tortilla.
Cut dough into smaller triangles.
Roll triangles from the wide edge to the thin edge and pinch the ends so croissant looks like a cresent moon.
Place on baking sheet.
Cook for 8 minutes.
Melt chocolate chips in microwave for a few seconds and use toothpick to drip chocolate onto croissant.
notes:
Rolling pin
Pizza cutter
baking sheet

name: Mint Chip Truffles
ingredients: 1/4 cup Cocoa powder, plus more for coating
directions: In a food processor and blend nuts and coconut flakes. Set aside.
Add dates to food processor and blend until they form a single ball.
Place nut and coconut mixture back into the food processor, and blend to combine. Add remaining ingredients and blend until combined.
Transfer "dough" to the freezer for 15 minutes to harden.
Remove from the freezer and roll in 1-inch balls. Place balls on a parchment-lined baking sheet and freeze for 30 to 45 minutes.
Once frozen, roll in coca powder or melted dark chocolate.

name: Mint Chocolate Meringues
directions: Preheat the oven to 235 degrees and line 2 baking trays with parchment paper.
Put the egg whites in a dry medium sized bowl and whisk until soft peaks form. Gradually add in the sugar one tablespoon at a time until fully incorporated.
Add in the peppermint extract and food coloring. Continue whisking until the sugar has dissolved and the meringue is thick and glossy.
Whisk in the corn flour and chocolate.
Drop heaped tablespoons onto prepared trays and reduce oven temperature to 200.
Bake for 1 hour and ten minutes or until they are crisp and hollow.
Turn off the oven and leave the meringues to cool with the door ajar.

name: Mint Swirl Brownies
ingredients: 1 oz. unsweetened chocolate, melted and cooled
directions: Cream together cream cheese, butter and sugar; beat in eggs.
Stir together flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into creamed mixture.
Spoon half of the batter from tablespoon checkerboard fashion into greased 9x9 baking pan.
To remaining batter, stir in extract and food coloring.
Spoon green batter into open spaces in baking pan.
Swirl with spatula to marble; do not over mix.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
Cool; pour Chocolate Glaze over top.
To make Chocolate Glaze, melt chocolate and butter over low heat; stir constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in powdered sugar and vanilla until crumbly.
Blend in enough boiling water until of pouring consistency.
notes: 1/3 cup chopped nuts (optional)

name: Minty Thins
directions: In a medium microwave safe bowl, combine shortening and mint extract. Microwave on high for 30 seconds.
Add Chocolate chips.
Microwave on medium for 1 1/2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds. Stir chocolate mixture until smooth.
Dip bottom of each cookie into the chocolate mixture and spread sooth with a knife.
Place cookies, chocolate side up on a wire rack. Let stand for about an hour or until chocolate hardens.
Repeat with other side of each wafer cookie so the whole cookie is covered with chocolate.
Let stand until chocolate hardens, sprinkling with sparkling sugar before it hardens.
notes: Freeze well for 1 month.

name: Mom's Pancake Recipe
directions: Mix all dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
Mix egg, milk, and oil together in a separate bowl.
Add milk, egg, and oil mixture to dry ingredients.
Mix well.

name: Monkey Bread
directions: pre-heat oven to 350 degrees
lightly grease bundt cake pan or cupcake tray
Separate dough into 16 biscuits
cut each biscuit in to 4 pieces
Put cinnamon and sugar into  a large bag and shake
Put in 1/2 of the biscuits (32) and shake until coated in cinnamon/sugar mixture
Put in pan
Melt butter and add brown sugar and pour over first half of dough
repeat 6-9 for second half
Bake for 28-35 minutes.
notes:
optional ingredients:
1/2 cup of walnuts
Pour butterscotch pudding on top

name: Muddie Buddies
directions: Combine the chocolate chips, peanut butter, and butter and microwave for 30 seconds on high heat. Pour on top of the Chex cereal, stirring until the cereal is well coated. Pour this mixture into a large ziploc bag and add the powdered sugar. Shake until well coated.
Transfer onto a baking sheet lined with wax paper and let cool.

name: Nachos Supreme
directions: Cook beef and taco seasoning in skillet until browned.
Drain off grease.
Add soup, water and rice.
Heat to boil.
Cover and cook over low heat 5 minutes or until done.

name: Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 375.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium sized bowl.
Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla extract in large bowl (or bosch/kitchen aid).
Add eggs one at a time to the mixture, beating well after each egg.
Gradually beat flour mixture into the large bowl.
Stir in chocolate chips *and chopped nuts.
notes: *1 cup chopped nuts optional

name: No-Bake Oreo Strawberry Cheesecake
ingredients: 9 Oreos + 4, cut in half, for decoration
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese, softened at room temperature
directions: Sprinkle gelatin into hot water and set aside for 10 minutes.
Combine 9 Oreos and melted butter inside a Ziploc bag and crush until crumbly.
Pour crumbs into a cheesecake pan lined with parchment paper and flatten down firmly with a spoon.
Arrange strawberry halves around the sides, with the insides of the strawberries facing outwards.
In a blender, combine cream cheese, heavy cream, yogurt, jam, lemon juice and gelatin mixture into the pan. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Once chilled and firm, transfer to a serving plate and decorate with more Oreos.

name: Oatmeal Cookies
directions: Mix all ingredients.
When dough is formed into balls dip tops in granulated sugar before placing on cookie sheet.

name: Olive Garden Alfredo Sauce
ingredients: 1/2 cup Whole milk, or more, to taste
directions: Combine butter, garlic, heavy cream, and milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer; remove from heat and stir in Parmesan and egg yolk, whisking constantly to prevent the eggs from scrambling.
Temper the eggs until they are warmer, then slowly add the egg mixture to the remaining cream mixture.
If the mixture is too thick, add more milk as needed.
Stir into pasta (drained well) or add to the fabulous meal of your choosing.
notes:
I don't know where the fettuccine fits into the recipe.
Add to noodles, grilled chicken, or seafood.

name: Olive Garden Salad - Dressing
directions: Mix all ingredients in a blender until well mixed.
If it's too tart, add a bit of sugar.

name: Olive Garden Salad - Salad
directions: Assemble ingredients as desired and top with dressing right before serving.

name: One Pan Pasta
ingredients: Small handful of basil, roughly chopped
directions: Arrange the tomatoes, basil, onion, and garlic across the base of a large frying pan and pour over the olive oil and 600ml of water or chicken stock.

Place the pan over a medium high heat and bring the contents of the pan to a boil. Using a tongs, stir the pasta regularly and cook for about 10 minutes until it's cooked and the liquid has nearly evaporated creating a sauce.
Add an extra splash of water if the sauce becomes too thick.
Remove the pan from heat and stir in the pecorino cheese and a little more basil. Season to serve.

name: One-Pot Baked Ziti
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups Water, or just enough to cover the pasta
directions: Heat a pan with olive oil over medium-high heat and quickly saute the onion until fragrant. Add the ziti, tomato puree and water. Stir to combine.
Cover and cook according to pasta box directions, then remove the cover.
Turn oven broil setting to high.
Dollop the ricotta into the pan and stir through the pasta to combine. Tear basil leaves into the pot and stir to gently wilt in the pasta.

Fold half of the shredded mozzarella into the pasta to incorporate, then sprinkle the other half over top for a cheesy layer. Taste; the cheese might have enough salt in it depending on the brand. If not, add salt to taste.
Place the uncovered casserole in the over on the second highest rack. Broil for 5 minutes or until the top cheese layer is golden.

name: Onion Rings
directions: Mix egg, oil, and milk on low speed of mixer for 1 minute.
Add dry ingredients and mix until smooth
Coat onions in flour.
Dip in batter.
When one side is golden, turn to the other side.
Fry in hot oil 350-375 F until desired shade of brown.
notes: If 375 is cooking the batter but the onion is still raw, lower the temperature of the oil to cook them slower. This will allow more time for the onion to soften up.

name: Orange Julius
directions: Blend everything together in bender until desired consistency.

name: Orange Rolls
directions: Beat eggs in a large bread bowl.
Scald milk, add butter, sugar and salt, and cool to lukewarm.
Add yeast mixture.
Add 1 cup of flour and mix well with a whip.
Let rise 1-2 hours then add remaining flour.
Mix well with a spoon. Don't knead.
Cover and let rise 2 hours.
Mix the last three ingredients.
Roll out dough as for cinnamon rolls.
Spread with the above mixture.
Cut into 2 dozen rolls and let rise for 1 hour.
Bake at  355 degrees for 12-15 minutes.

name: Oreo Cheesecake Tart
ingredients: 3/4 cup Chopped Reeses peanut butter cups
directions: Crust: Add whole Oreos to a food processor and blend until you reach a fine crumb. Add melted butter and mix until well combined. It should look like wet soil.
Add to a tart tin either rectangle (36 x 13 x cm) or round 12 inches. Use the back of a tablespoon to evenly distribute crust around pressing down firmly on the side and bottom. Chill for 1 hour.
Cheesecake: Add all ingredients to a large mixing bowl and use a hand mixer or a wooden spoon and mix until well combined.
Ganache: Add chocolate and cream to a microwave safe bowl and microwave for 20 seconds at a time mixing each time until it becomes smooth.

Add cheesecake to the tart tin and use a tablespoon to spread evenly. Pour on ganache (set aside a little to drizzle on top) and spread evenly. Sprinkle the chopped Reeses peanut butter cups, drizzle more ganache on top.
Serve chilled.

name: Oreo Pie
directions: Blitz the oreos in the food processor.
Add in the melted butter and stir.
Pressed into a greased pie tin and push down evenly with a spatula or the back of a spoon until the bottom and sides are completely covered.
Leave in the fridge to set while you make the filling.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the double cream, icing sugar and the cream cheese. Break up the remaining cookies and place half in the mix. Remove the pie shell from its tin at this point and place on a plate or board.
Pour in the filling and keep in the fridge until serving for at least an hour.
Just before serving drizzle over the melted chocolate and the rest of the broken cookies if there are some left.

name: Pancakes
directions: Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, combine egg and milk; add to flour mixture, stirring only until smooth.
Blend in melted butter.
Cook.

name: Parmesan Zucchini Fries
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups panko or plain bread crumbs
directions: Preheat oven to 425°. Arrange an oven rack in the lower third of the oven and a second one in the center. Line 2 rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper. Cut zucchini into thick French-fry-size sticks, about 3 inches long.

Arrange 3 shallow, wide bowls or pie plates in a row. In the first bowl, stir together flour, 1 tsp. salt, and 1/2 tsp. pepper. In the second bowl, whisk together eggs, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper. In the third bowl, combine panko, Parmesan, dill (if using), and 1/2 tsp. salt.
Working in batches, first dip zucchini in flour, shaking off excess. Transfer to egg mixture and toss until coated. Let excess egg run off, then coat zucchini in panko mixture.
Arrange zucchini, without crowding, in a single layer on the prepared pans. Bake 15 minutes and then rotate the pans. Continue to bake until panko coating is golden and crisp, 7 to 12 minutes more.

name: Parmesan Zucchini Sticks
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat a cooling rack with nonstick spray and place on a baking sheet; set aside.
In a small bowl, combine Parmesan, thyme, oregano, basil, garlic powder, salt and pepper, to taste.

Place zucchini onto prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with Parmesan mixture. Place into oven and bake until tender, about 15 minutes. Then broil for 2-3 minutes, or until crisp and golden brown.
Serve immediately, garnished with parsley, if desired.

name: Pasta with Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto
ingredients: 1 (8.5 oz.) jar sun-dried tomatoes packed in olive oil
directions: Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, blend the sun-dried tomatoes and the oil, garlic, salt and pepper to taste, and basil in a food processor and blend until tomatoes are finely chopped.
Transfer the tomato mixture to a large bowl. Stir in the Parmesan.
Add the pasta to the pesto and toss to coat, adding enough reserved cooking liquid to moisten.
Season the pasta, to taste, with salt and pepper.

name: Peach Cobbler
directions: Mix peach ingredients and bring to a boil.
To make biscuit dough, cut shortening into dry ingredients.
Mix egg and milk together and add to rest of mixture, stirring just enough to combine.
Arrange dough by spoonfuls.
Bake for 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

name: Peanut Brittle
directions: Combine syrup, sugar and water in a saucepan.
Slowly bring to 230 degrees or until syrup spins a thread.
Add peanuts and continue to cook to 300 degrees.
Remove from heat, add remaining ingredients.
Stir until blended.
Pour into well buttered jiffy roll pan or large platter.
Then, if desired, put on counter top and pull when cool and break into pieces.

name: Peanut Butter and Honey Oatmeal Drops
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, salt and oats.
In a large bowl, mix together peanut butter, honey, eggs, water, vanilla until well blended. Add flour mixture and mix well. Fold in Craisins. Refrigerate dough for 30 minutes until firm.

Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 2-inches apart, onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until tops spring back when lightly touched. Immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

name: Peanut Butter Chip Scones
directions: Preheat oven to 425 F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Cut the cold butter into the dry ingredients with a pastry cutter, two forks, or crumble the butter in with your fingers.
Mix in the peanut butter, heavy cream, beaten egg, and both chocolate chips until completely combines and chocolate chips are evenly dispersed. (Do NOT over mix even with extra chunks of butter.)
Form dough into mounds and place on baking sheet, leaving about 2 inches between the scones. Don't compact them too much or they will lose their fluffiness.
Brush milk over the raw scones and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for about 12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Peanut Butter Cookie Brownie Bars
ingredients: 1 package (19.9 ounces) dark chocolate brownie mix, Duncan Hines
1 package (16 ounces) refrigerated filled peanut butter cookie dough, nestle ultimates
directions: Preheat oven to 350.
Spray 9" square baking pan with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, stir together brownie mix, oil, milk, and eggs until well mixed. Pour half the batter into prepared baking pan.
Break apart cookie dough pieces and randomly drop the pieces into the batter.
Pour the rest of the remaining batter over the cookie dough and spread it smoothly.
(Sprinkle on the nuts).
Bake for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
notes: sprinkle 1 package (2.25 ounces) of nuts on top is desired

name: Peanut Butter Cup Ice Cream
directions: Place Reese's in freezer long enough for them to harden.
Add cocoa powder to sweetened condensed milk and stir until dissolved.
Heat Peanut Butter in microwave for 20 seconds to melt, then stir and set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, whisk heavy cream until soft peaks form.
Fold in condensed milk mixture until blended.
Unwrap and cut peanut butter cups in quarters.
Fold 2/3 of the candy into the mixture.
Spread a third of this mixture into a loaf pan and drizzle with melted peanut butter.
Repeat this for two more layers.
Take a knife and run through pan to swirl mixture.
Top with the remaining candy pieces.
Cover with foil and freeze for 6 hours or until firm.

name: Peanut Butter Cup Pizza
ingredients: Enough Chocolate Chips to cover a pizza crust
Some form of Peanut Butter Drizzle
directions: Make Pizza Crust - Mix 2 cups of flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
Add water and oil; mix well.
Add remaining flour.
Knead 5 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough.
Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
While the crust is still warm, spread chocolate chips across the crust.
Cut up reese's Peanut Butter cups and sprinkle across.
Drizzle peanut Butter drizzle stuff on top of everything.
notes: Makes one pizza crust

name: Peanut Butter Frosting
directions: In a mixing bowl beat peanut butter till fluffy. Gradually add 2 cups of powdered sugar. beat well.
Slowly beat in the 1/4 cup of milk and vanilla.
Slowly beat in remaining powdered sugar.
Beat in additional milk, if needed, to reach spreading consistency.
notes: add additional milk to thin consistency.

name: Peanut Butter Lava Cake
directions: Peanut Butter Sauce: In a small saucepan, combine all peanut butter sauce ingredients and cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Set aside to cool.
Lava Cake: Preheat oven to 425 F. With one tablespoon of butter, grease for 1 cup ramekins or cake molds well.
In a medium heatproof bowl set over a pot of simmering water, melt chocolate and remaining butter, stirring occasionally.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, yolks and sugar until combined, then add the flour and cocoa powder. Add the chocolate mixture and mix until well combined.
Spoon an eighth of the chocolate mixture into each mold, then make a well in the batter and spoon 2 tablespoons of peanut butter into the center of each.
Cover with the remaining chocolate mixture, and place all 4 molds on a sturdy baking sheet. Bake for about 13 minutes, or until sides are set but the center of the cakes retain a bit of a jiggle.

Turn out cakes as quickly as possible, top with peanut butter sauce, dust with cocoa powder and serve immediately. It is important to serve lava cakes before they cool so the center will remain liquid.

name: Peppermint Hot Chocolate Molten Cake
directions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Butter and lightly flour four 6-oz ramekins. Tap out excess flour over sink.
Place a nonreactive bowl over a pot of simmering water.
Add butter and chocolate to bowl and melt together, stirring occasionally.
In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs and egg yolks, sugar and salt until pale and thickened.

Whisk chocolate and butter mixture until completely smooth. Using a rubber spatula, quickly fold the chocolate mixture into egg mixture along with the flour until smooth. Add peppermint extract and mix.
Evenly pour batter into prepared ramekins. Transfer ramekins to a rimmed sheet tray and bake in oven until tops are almost set but center is jiggly, about 12 minutes.
In the meantime, prepare ganache. Place chocolate in a nonreactive bowl. Heat heavy cream in a saucepan over medium heat just until cream reaches a boil.
Pour hot cream over chocolate and let stand for 1 minute. Stir chocolate with cayenne until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add peppermint extract and stir. Set aside.
Remove cakes from oven and allow to cool in ramekins for 1 minute. Place dessert plate on top of each ramekin and flip cakes.
Let ramekins stand for 10 seconds before removing. Drizzle ganache over the tops of the cakes and allow to drip.

name: Pfefferneusse (Pepper Nuts)
directions: Warm molasses, karo syrup, shortening, and brown sugar in  pot and stir until dissolved.
Add lemon juice, rind, and spices.
Add flour mixed with baking soda.
Stir then refrigerate until chilled.
Make rolls about the size of a penny.
Cut several rolls at a time if you like, 1/3 inch thick.
Bake at 350 degrees for 8 minutes.
Let cool a few seconds before removing from cookie sheet.

name: Pie Crust
directions: Mix first 3 ingredients together.
Cut in the shortening.
In a small bowl, mix the last 3 ingredients.
Then mix all ingredients together.
Don't stir for too long or the crust won't be moist.
Divide into 4 balls.
roll ball of dough out on a floured piece of wax paper.
flip wax paper over into the pie pan.

name: Pineapple Coconut Smoothies
directions: Put coconut milk, pineapple, and banana into a blender and blend for about 15 seconds.
Add the yogurt and honey,
Blend until smooth.
Serve as a smoothie or turn the mixture into Popsicles.

name: Pita Chips
directions: Preheat the oven to 350.
Toast the sesame seeds for 1 minutes over low heat in a  small frying pan. Remove from heat.

Brush the pita with the egg white. Sprinkle with the toasted sesame seeds. Cut each pita into 6 wedges. Arrange the wedges in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake until lightly brown, about 8 minutes. Transfer to a rack and let cool.
The chips can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for 2 weeks.

name: Potato Wedges with Parmesan
ingredients: 3 Large russet potatoes, cut into wedges
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.

Place potato wedges in a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil, then sprinkle with salt, garlic powder, Italian seasoning and Parmesan cheese. Use hands to mix well, making sure all wedges are well coated.
On a baking sheet covered with parchment paper, spread out potato wedges in a single layer. Bake for 25-35 minutes, until potatoes are golden.

name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 400°. Place paper liners in a regular sized muffin pan.

In a large bowl, beat the eggs, sugar, pumpkin and oil until smooth. Combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice and salt; Add flour mixture slowly to pumpkin mixture and mix well. Fold in chocolate chips. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups three-fourths to almost all the way full.

Bake for 15-17 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Do not over bake. It makes all the difference between a good and a great muffin. Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack.

name: Pumpkin Pie
directions: Mix sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger and cloves in a small bowl.
Beat eggs in a large bowl.
Stir in pumpkin and sugar spice mixture.
Gradually stir in the evaporated milk.
Pour into the pie crust.
Bake in preheated oven at 425 for 15 minutes.
reduce temperature to 350.
Bake for 40-50 minutes or until knife comes out clean.
Cool on wire rack for 2 hours.

name: Pumpkin-Oat Chocolate Chip Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a mixing bowl whisk together flour baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger for 30 seconds, set aside.
In an electric mixing bowl, whip together butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar until creamy.
Blend in egg then blend in vanilla extract and pumpkin puree.
With mixer set on low, slowly add in dry ingredients and mix until combined.
Mix in chocolate chips and let batter rest for 5-10 minutes.
Scoop dough onto a cookie pan and bake for 12-14 minutes.

name: Queso Fundido
ingredients: 12 ounces monterey jack cheese, grated (about 3 cups)
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
8 ounces goat cheese, sliced into 8 rounds
directions: Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat; add the flour and cook, whisking, 1 minute. Whisk in the milk and cook, whisking, until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the monterey jack. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste. Turn on the broiler.

Scrape the cheese mixture into an 8-inch cast-iron pan and arrange the goat cheese rounds on top. Broil until golden brown in spots. Drizzle with the vinaigrette and sprinkle with the cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips.
notes: http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/bobby-flay/queso-fundido-with-roasted-poblano-vinaigrette-recipe.html?oc=linkback

name: Raspberry Cheesecake Dessert Parfait
directions: Begin by preparing custard base for the cheesecake: Whisk together 1/2 cup sugar with 4 egg yolks and vanilla extract in a small bowl.

In a small saucepan, whisk together 1 cup cream with the flour. Cook the cream mixture over low heat for a few minutes until hot; Stir constantly and whisk vigorously to remove clumps. Slowly pour cream into the egg yolks, whisking constantly. Cook custard over low/medium heat for 7-10 minutes until thickened.
Remove from heat and add white chocolate; whisk until completely melted. Cover custard and set aside to cool to room temperature.
meanwhile, prepare crust. Place pretzels and graham crackers in a food processor and crush into small crumbs. combine crumbs with 1/3 cup melted butter; set aside.

Once custard has cooled, prepare cheesecake mousse. Whisk cream cheese in a mixer bowl until light and fluffy. Add the two cups raspberries and the raspberry extract. Mix until raspberries are completely crushed. Add the cooled custard and blend until well combined; scrape down sides of bowl often. Remove mixture from mixer bowl into a separate bowl.

Into clean mixer bowl, add the remaining two cups heavy cream and 1/4 cups sugar. Whisk on high speed until stiff peaks form. Fold 1 cup whipped cream into cream cheese mixture, then gradually begin folding cream cheese into the whipped cream.Fold very gently so the whipped cream stays light and airy.

To assemble dessert, spoon several tablespoons of graham cracker crumbs into plastic or glass cups. Transfer mousse into a pastry bag and pipe into cups, filling about 3/4 of the cup. Place cups into the refrigerator for about 1 hour to set.

Prepare the Jell-o according the package instructions replacing the cold water with ice water to cool down the mixture faster. Add fresh raspberries on top of the mousse, then carefully pour over the Jell-o. Fill the cups to the brim. Place in refrigerator to set completely (4-6 hours). Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

name: Raspberry Cheesecake Dessert Parfait - Crust
notes: This is the Cheesecake crust for the Cheesecake Mousse

name: Raspberry Chocolate Chip Crackles
directions: Preheat oven to 300 F.
In the top of a double broiler, over hot water, melt butter with 1 cup raspberry chocolate chips, stirring until smooth. Remove from hot water and set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, and salt.

In a large bowl, beat sugar with melted butter mixture. Add eggs, one at a time, beating until incorporated. Beat in flour mixture until well blended. Fold in walnuts and remaining raspberry chips. Wrap dough tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least an hour.
Shape dough into 1 inch balls about 2 inches apart on prepared cookie sheets. Bake in oven for 15 to 18 minutes or until cracked on the surface but set in the middle.

name: Raspberry Jam
directions: Place the raspberries and sugar in a pot set to medium heat. Stir until the sugar has melted.
Increase the heat to high and bring to a boil. Scoop the scum off the surface. Reduce until your desired consistency is reached.
Add the lemon juice and mix well. Pour the jam into a sterilized jar and screw the lid on top. Flip over and place in the fridge to chill.

name: Raspberry Mustard Sauce
directions: Combine all ingredients. Cover and chill until serving time.
notes: Eat with roast turkey or grilled chicken.

name: Reeses Peanut Butter Candy
directions: Combine everything except for the chocolate chips.
Press into a small baking pan 9x9.
Melt the chocolate chips and spread on top.

name: Risotto with Shrimp and Asparagus
ingredients: 2 lbs. Uncooked shrimp (26-30 per lb.), peeled and deveined
directions: Select saute setting on a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker and adjust for high heat; warm butter until melted. Add onion; cook 4-5 minutes. Add garlic; cook 1 minute. Add rice; cook and stir 2 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup wine; cook and stir until absorbed. Add remaining wine, broth, and 1/4 cup cheese. Lock lid and make sure the vent is closed. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high. Set the time for 8 minutes. When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to manufacturer's directions; stir.

Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic; cook 1 minute. Add shrimp; cook and stir until the shrimp begin to turn pink, about 5 minutes. Add butter and dressing; stir until butter melts. Reduce heat. Add asparagus; cook until tender, 3-5 minutes. Serve over risotto. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
notes: Cook time: 30 minutes

name: Roasted Chickpeas
ingredients: 1 1/2 cup Canned Chickpeas, strained and pat dried
directions: Preheat oven to 375 F. Toss everything together and spread on a baking sheet. Baked for 30 minutes, tossing the chickpeas every 10 minutes to prevent burning.
notes: Movie Night Snacks

name: Roasted Garlic Spread
ingredients: 1/2 tsp. Fresh thyme or 1/4 tsp. dried
directions: Preheat oven to 350.

Remove the papery outside layer of the garlic. Trim 1/4 inch off the tops of the garlic heads. Place them in an ovenproof dish and brush with the oil. Sprinkle with thyme, salt and pepper. Cover the dish with foil and bake 1 1/2 hours, or until very tender.
Serve warm or at room temperature. To remove the garlic, gently squeeze if from the husks.

name: Roasted Strawberries (Ice Cream)
ingredients: 3 cups Fresh strawberries, hulled and halved
1/2 cup Roasted strawberries, plus some for topping
directions: Roasted Strawberries: Preheat oven to 375F. Place strawberries on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Toss with sugar and salt. Roast for 20-25 minutes.

Roasted Strawberry Coconut Ice Cream: In a bowl, combine coconut milk, roasted strawberries, honey, vanilla, and salt. Transfer to a freezer-safe container and freeze until set. Serve with more roasted strawberries and chopped pistachios.

name: Rosemary and Onion Focaccia
directions: Follow Pizza dough recipe instructions. Roll or press the dough to fit an oiled baking sheet. Cover with a small towel and let rise.
When the dough has risen, dimple the top with your fingers. Brush with 3 Tbsp. of olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Set aside.

Heat the remaining 3 Tbsp. of olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over low heat. Add the onions, sugar, salt, and rosemary. Cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are tender and lightly brown. Cool to room temperature.
Preheat the oven to 350F. Spread the onions evenly over the dough. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the bottom is crisp. Cut into 2-inch wedges and serve.

name: S'more Dip
directions: Pour as many chocolate chips of both kinds into the bottom of the pan.
Line and cover the top of the chocolate with the large marshmallows.
put in oven long enough to melt the chocolate and slightly brown the marshmallows.
Dip graham crackers into the melt mixture and eat.
notes: experiment with temperatures

name: Salt Dough
directions: Combine salt and flour.
Add oil and enough water to give it a clay like consistency.
mix food coloring into water before adding it to the mixture if you wish to color it.
Add more water a little at a time until the mixture is pliable but not sticky.
Knead slightly.
Keep in air tight container.
notes:
Less oily and more salty than clay in book one.
Primary book recipe.

name: Salted Caramel
directions: In a medium saucepan, heat sugar and water on medium high heat.
Cook until sugar turns into amber hue. DO NOT USE YOUR SPOON TO STIR. it'll cause the caramel to crystalize.
Quickly add the butter and swirl into the pan until it's combined.
Then add the cream and sea salt and stir to combine.
Let cool completely.
notes: Add into the middle layer of the brownies. then spread the rest on top.

name: Salted Caramel and Chocolate Ice Cream
directions: Heat sugar and water in large saute pan. When it begins to melt and turn amber, swirl the pan to incorporate all the sugar and cook until fully melted and amber. Pour the room temperature cream and salt flakes into the sugar mixture and transfer to a bowl to cool.
While it's cooling, heat the milk and heavy cream to a slight simmer.

While that's heating, beat the egg yolks and sugar until pale yellow. Temper the egg yolks by slowly pouring the heated milk and cream into the yolks. Return the mixture to the original pot and cook slowly while stirring until it coats the back of the wooden spoon. Pour this mixture into the caramel and stir to fully incorporate. Chill for 2-4 hours.
Once the custard is cool, add it to an ice cream maker and churn until thick.

When the mixture is almost done, make the ganache. Heat the chocolate chips over a double boiler until melted, then stir in cream and cayenne. Cool at room temperature, then pour into the ice cream maker. Continue to churn for about 40 seconds.
Put ice cream in a container and freeze for at least two hours.

name: Salted Caramel Brownies
directions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Line an 8x8 inch pan with parchment or foil, set aside.
In a medium saucepan, meltbutter and sugar on medium high heat.
Once melted, remove and stir in vanilla extract and cocoa powder. Set aside and let cool for 5 minutes.
To the cooled butter mixture, whisk in egg one at a time, mix until incorporated.
In a large bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, cornstarch and salt.
Incorporate the butter mixture to the flour mixture and mix until combined.
Fold in chocolate chips, and pour brownie batter over prepared pan.
Next, take salted caramel and drizzle over brownies. Using the back of a spoon, swirl the caramel around.
Bake brownies for 22-25 minutes, or until brownies are set.

name: Salted caramel Meringues
directions: Preheat oven to 200 degrees.
Line a flat baking tray with baking paper.
Whip the egg whites on high speed with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
Gradually, and very slowly, add the sugar 1 Tbsp at a time, while whipping it together on a medium high speed.

Once all the sugar is in, add the vanilla extract and continue whipping for 5-6 minutes or until you reach stiff peaks. If you can turn the bowl upside down and no meringue fall out, you know it's done.
Dab a little meringue on the corners of the baking tray and stick the baking paper to it. This prevents it from flying around the oven.
Scoop the meringue onto the tray to form little mounds,
Bake the meringues for 90 minutes. Do not open the oven door at any point or they will crack. Once they're finished, turn off the heat and leave them in the oven to cool completely.
Drizzle salted caramel sauce over the meringue mounds, sprinkle on some sea salt flakes and add caramel chews.
notes: Stores for 3 days (not refridgerated)

name: Scalloped Hasselback Potatoes
ingredients: 1 piece about 2 inches long parmigiano-reggiano cheese, sliced thinly
directions: Preheat oven to 400ºF. Scrub potatoes.

You need 2 wooden spoons with handles of the same width. Place a spoon on each side of the potato and start slicing the potato into thin slices. The spoons will stop the knife from cutting all the way through the potato.

Slice the butter into thin pieces. Alternate the butter and the parmesan, stuffing them in between the slices of the potato. Season the potato with garlic powder and kosher salt. Drizzle the potato with olive oil.
Bake at 400ºF for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and drizzle heavy cream over the potatoes. Top with cheddar cheese.
Place back in the oven for 10-12 more minutes. Remove and serve!

name: Scones
directions: Mix dry ingredients.
Cut in shortening and butter.
Add milk and mix.
Turn out on lightly floured board.
Knead 20 or so times.
Divide dough into thirds. Pat each into a circle about 4-5 inches across. Cut each into quarters or thirds.
Let rise on cookie sheet for a few minutes.
Bake at 425F for about 7-10 minutes or until golden brown.
notes:
Serve with honey.
Add different fillings like grated lemon and poppy seeds, grated orange and cranberries, dark chocolate and cranberries, etc.

name: Sesame Honey Chicken Drumettes
directions: Preheat the oven to 375.
Combine the honey, mustard, soy sauce, rice vinegar and chili flakes in a small bowl. Set aside.

Rinse the drumettes under cold water and pat dry. Place them in a roasting pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake, uncovered, for 40 minutes, turning after 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and discard the fat and liquid.

Pour the honey mustard sauce over the drumettes and toss well. Return to the oven. Bake until the chicken is crispy and golden in color, about 30 to 40 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter, sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve immediately.
notes: Toast the sesame seeds in a dry frying pan over low heat for 2-3 minutes.

name: Shrimp Cocktail Sauce
directions: Combine all the ingredients and mix well. Cover and chill for 30 minutes before serving.
The sauce can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 2 weeks.

name: Sizzling Sesame Shrimp Noodles
ingredients: 4 cup Frozen Asian-style stir-fry veggies, thawed
directions: Cook pasta as directed on package.
Heat 2 Tbsp. of dressing in 1g. skillet on medium-high heat.
Add shrimp, garlic and sesame seed.
(If using Chinese Spice-add now)
Stir fry for 3 minutes.
Add veggies, soy sauce, and remaining dressing.
Stir-fry 3 minutes or until veggies are heated through.
Drain pasta and toss with shrimp.
notes:
Dressing can be substituted with 2 Tbsp. olive/veggie oil and 1-2 tsp. of Chinese spice.

Shrimp can be substituted with bite size chicken strips.

name: Skillet Cinna-Buns
directions: Add the yeast into the milk, stir together and leave to sit for a few minutes. Whisk in the eggs to combine.
In a stand mixer, add all of the dry ingredients and butter and with a dough hook attached, slowly pour in the wet ingredients and knead for 5 minutes until soft.
Place the dough in an oiled bowl and allow it to rise for an hour or doubled in volume.
Once ready, knock the dough back and using a rolling pin, roll it into a large rectangle.
Spread the soft butter on top of the dough. Mix together the sugar and cinnamon and spread this evenly over the top.
From the short side of the rectangle, roll the dough into a tight log. Cut into 1 inch discs and arrange the rounds into a buttered skillet pan.
Allow to rise for 20 minutes, then bake at 395 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown on top.
While cooking, mix the cream cheese butter, icing sugar and vanilla together.
Spread the mixture on top of the cinna-buns as soon as they re baked and serve.

name: Skinny Mac and Cheese Soup with Broccoli
ingredients: salt and fresh pepper to taste
2 1/2 cups fat free low sodium chicken broth (or vegetable broth)
2 cups (about 10 oz) broccoli florets, chopped into small pieces
directions: Boil pasta in salted water according to package directions for al dente. Drain and set aside.
Chop onion, carrot, celery, garlic by hand or mini food processor.
In a large soup pot or dutch oven, melt light butter.  Add chopped vegetables and sauté on low heat until soft, about 5 minutes.

Add flour and fresh pepper to the pot and stir until smooth. Slowly add chicken broth, milk, nutmeg and dry mustard powder; whisking constantly.  Set heat to medium-high until it comes to a boil. Cover and cook on low about 10-15 minutes.
Add broccoli florets, Parmesan cheese, and stir well. Adjust salt and pepper to taste. Cook uncovered until broccoli is cooked, about 5 minutes or more to your liking.

Add cheddar, mixing well until cheese melts and immediately remove from heat. Add cooked elbows and mix well, adjust salt and pepper if needed. Eat right away so the pasta doesn't absorb all the broth.
notes: Any noodle works

name: Snickerdoodle Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Mix butter, 1 1/2 cups sugar and eggs thoroughly in a large bowl.
Combine flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl.
Blend dry ingredients into butter or margarine.
Chill dough, and chill an ungreased cookie sheet for about 10-15 minutes in the fridge.
Meanwhile, mix 3 tablespoons sugar, and 3 teaspoons cinnamon in a small bowl.
Scoop 1 inch globs of dough into the sugar and cinnamon mixture.
Coat by gently rolling balls of dough in the sugar mixture.
Place on chilled ungreased cookie sheet, and bake 10 minutes.
Remove from pan immediately.

name: Sophie's Chopped Salad
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup Canned chick-peas, rinsed and drained
1⁄2 cup Nicoise olive, pitted and coarsely chopped
directions: In a blender, or with a wire whisk, blend balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly blend in oil and blend until emulsified.
Toss lettuce, tomatoes, beans, chickpeas, olives and cheeses together in large bowl and dress lightly with vinaigrette. Garnish with tortilla chips and chives.
notes: http://www.food.com/recipe/sophies-chopped-salad-432126

name: Southwestern Fries
directions: Combine the ancho powder and salt in a small bowl.
Cut the potatoes into 1/4-inch-thick slices, then cut each slice into 1/4-inch-thick fries. Place the fries in a  large bowl of cold water.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan to 325 degrees F as measured on a deep-frying thermometer. Drain the fries in batches on paper towels. Fry each batch for 3 to 4 minutes, until pale blond color. Remove to a sheet pan lined with paper towels.

Raise the heat of the oil to 375 degrees F. Working in batches, fry the potatoes again, until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove to a sheet pan lined with paper towels and season with the chile mixture and cilantro.

name: Spun Sugar Decorations
directions: Prepare a baking sheet with a silicon mat or wax paper.
Melt the sugar in a pan, stirring until it has completely melted into caramel.
Allow to cool slightly, then begin to pull your sugar decorations.
For a sugar disc, drizzle the caramel in a circular motion over the baking sheet, and allow to cool completely.
For the spiral, make sure the caramel is slightly cooler and holding its shape. Twirl the sugar around a steel knife-sharpening blade to create tight spiral effect.

name: Steamed Dumplings
directions: Heat the oil to medium-high in a large, non-stick frying pan. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger and cook about 5 minutes, or until soft and fragrant.
Add the mushrooms and cook until tender. Transfer to a large bowl and add the carrot, soy sauce, sesame oil, cilantro and pepper. Toss gently.

Lay out as many dumpling wrappers as you have room for on your work surface. Lightly brush the edges of each wrapper with warm water. Place a heaping spoonful of filling in the edges firmly to seal. Place the finished dumplings on a baking sheet and cover with waxed paper.
Repeat with the remaining wrappers. The dumplings can be frozen on the baking sheet, transferred to an airtight container and kept in the freezer for 2 months.

To cook the dumplings, line a bamboo steamer or colander with lettuce. Arrange in a single layer over the lettuce and cover with the lid. Place over a pot of simmering water and steam for 12 minutes. Serve immediately with dipping sauce.
notes: Use Bamboo steamer or line a metal colander with lettuce leaves, cover it with a lid and place directly over a pot of simmering water.

name: Stovetop Potpourri
directions: Fill a pot with water and the ingredients.
Allow to come to a boil and then reduce the heat to low.
Be sure not to let the water evaporate completely. You can refill the pot with as much water as needed.

name: Strawberry Cream Puffs
directions: Bring the milk, water, sugar, salt, and butter to a boil. Remove from heat, add flour and incorporate mixing with a wooden spoon until homogeneous. Return over low heat and while stirring cook for 2 minutes to pull out the moisture and pulls away from the sides of the pan. Allow to cool slightly. Add the eggs one at a time, using the wooden spoon or even a stand mixer.
Pipe the dough into 1 to 1.5 inch circles. Bake for 25-30 minutes at 350F until browned and puffed. Prick each with a skewer to release steam and allow to cool on a wire rack.

Whip the cream until it forms stiff peaks. Add sugar and vanilla extract and mix to combine. Split the cream puffs in half and fill them with cream mixture and strawberry slices. Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

name: Strawberry Ice Box Cake
ingredients: 1 pint whipping cream, whipped with sugar added
directions: Pour half ground wafers in 9x13 pan.
Mix butter and sugar then add eggs one at a time and beat hard.
Carefully spread this mixture on wafers; then put on a layer of fruit, (nuts), and whipped cream.
Top with remainder of wafers.
Let stay in refrigerator overnight.
notes: 1 cup pecans or walnuts, chopped (optional)

name: Strawberry Jam
directions: Put in pan and boil for 1 minute; stir constantly.
Take off stove and stir in 1 small package of strawberry Jell-O.
Blend well.
Put in bottles/jars and freeze.

name: Sugar Cookies
ingredients: Powdered sugar, for rolling out dough
directions: Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
Place butter and sugar in large bowl or electric mixer and beat until light in color.
Add egg and milk and beat to combine.
Put mixer on low speed, gradually add flour, and beat until mixture pulls away from the side of the bowl.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Sprinkle surface where you will roll out dough with flour. Roll out dough to 1/4 inch thick.
Move the dough around and check underneath frequently to make sure it is not sticking.
Cut into desired shape, place at least 1 inch apart and bake for 7 to 9 minutes or until cookies are just beginning to turn brown around the edges, rotating cookie sheet half way through baking time.
notes: store up to a week

name: Sugar Cookies
directions: Sift flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda.
Cut in butter and shortening.
Beat eggs and sugar until fluffy.
Add flavoring and combine mixture.
Roll dough.
Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes.

name: Summer Pasta Salad
directions: Cook pasta al dente in abundantly salty water, drain and add a drizzle of olive oil. Stir to coat and set aside to cool.
Slice the mushrooms, carrot, cucumber and red pepper into bite-sized pieces. Add to a large bowl along with the corn kernels. Halve the cherry tomatoes and add to the bowl as well.

If using olives with pits, take a small clean rag and lay olives across one half of the towel. Fold the other half over the olives and press down firmly on them to gently squash them. Pits will easily slide out while retaining the shape of the olive. Discard pits and add olives to the bowl.
Break apart the cheese and tear the basil into bite-sized pieces, directly into the bowl.
Stir to combine so the tomatoes release some of their juice. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil and stir to coat. season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve at room temperature; the longer you this dish sit, the better it tastes!

name: Sunrise Smoothies
directions: Put milk, juice, and the peaches into a blender. Blend for about 45 seconds.
Then add the yogurt, vanilla, and honey.
Blend until smooth.
Serve it as a smoothie or turn the mixture into Popsicles.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
directions: Put chicken in 9x13 baking pan.
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a medium sauce pan, mix everything else and bring to a boil.
Stir constantly.
Pour hot liquid over chicken.
Cover pan with tin foil and cook for 4o minutes for tenderloins or an  hour for chicken breasts.

name: Sweet and Sour Pork
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs. Boneless pork loin roast, cut into 1-in strips
directions: Place paprika in a large resealable plastic bag. Add pork, a few pieces at a time, and shake to coat. Select saute setting on a 6-qt electric pressure cooker and adjust to medium heat; add oil. Brown the pork in batches, then return all pork to pressure cooker.

Drain Pineapple, reserving juice, onion, green pepper, vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce and salt to the pressure cooker. Lock lid; make sure the vent is closed. Select manual; adjust pressure to high and set time for 10 minutes. When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to the manufacturer's instructions.

Select saute setting and adjust for high heat, bring liquid to a boil. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water until smooth; gradually stir into pork mixture. Add pineapple. Cook and stir until sauce is thickened (1-2 minutes).
If desired, sprinkle with green onions and serve over rice.
notes:
Prep: 20 min
Cook: 15 min

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
ingredients: 3 cup cooked canned yams, mashed with fork
directions: Mix yams, butter, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon and egg and pour into casserole dish.
Mix flour and brown sugar and spread over top.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Then spread marshmallows on top and bake for 10 minutes.
notes: 1 cup chopped nuts

name: Sweet Soy Sauce
directions: Combine all ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for up to 5 days.

name: Tiffany's Pizza Recipe
directions: Mix 2 cups of flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
Add water and oil; mix well.
Add remaining flour.
Knead 5 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough.
Add sauce and toppings.
Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
notes: Makes one pizza crust.

name: Tri-Color Neapolitan Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking powder and salt.
In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg until incorporated. Stir in vanilla. Gradually add flour mixture and mix until a soft dough forms.
Divide dough into three equal portions. Place one portion in a small bowl. Add almond extract and red food coloring in and knead until fully integrated into the dough.

Spread this portion evenly over the bottom of the prepared pan. Add nuts to another portion and knead well. Spread this portion evenly over the first layer. Add cocoa to the last portion and knead until it is evenly distributed throughout the dough.
Spread this portion over the second layer. Cover with plastic wrap or waxed paper and refrigerate overnight.
When ready to bake, remove from pan and cut loose in half lengthwise. Cut each half into slices 1/4 thick. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until firm.
notes:
9x5 inch loaf pan, bottom and sides lined with wax paper
Cookie sheet, ungreased

name: Virginia's Dinner Rolls
directions: Melt butter.
Add very hot water, salt and sugar.
Stir to dissolve.
Place in mixing bowl.
Add 3 cups of flour and powdered milk; mix very well.
Add beaten eggs.
add yeast which has been dissolved in 1/3 cup warm water.
Add flour gradually. Turn out on floured board.
Cover, let rest for 10 minutes.
Knead till smooth and satiny.
Place in container to raise. Let raise until double.
Roll out on lightly floured board, 1/2 inch thick. Cut rolls and place on greased pans.
Let raise and bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes.
Brush with melted butter after baking.

name: Waffle Donut
ingredients: 3 1/2 oz. Chilled butter, cut into small cubes
directions: Combine milk and a pinch of the sugar into a medium sized bowl. Sprinkle over yeast and set aside for 5-6 minutes or until foamy. Stir in the remaining sugar and egg yolks until combined.
In a large bowl add the flour. Rub the butter to the flour until the mixture resembles a bread crumb consistency.
Pour in the egg mixture and stir until a rough dough forms. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes or until a smooth dough forms.
Place into a lightly oiled bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide into 12 equal portions and roll each into a ball and then flatten slightly.
Spray a waffle maker with grease and place 4 balls on the hot iron. Press down and cook using the machines normal timing.

Once the donuts are all cooked and cooling begin making the glaze. In a bowl combine the melted butter, maple syrup and icing sugar. Whisk until smooth. Dip each waffle donut in the glaze and top with small ripped pieces of the candied bacon.
notes: Make candied bacon: Preheat oven to 375 F. Place bacon strips on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Drizzle 1 tsp of maple syrup over each slice of bacon. Bake for 10 minutes, flip strips and bake for another 5 minutes. Use 1 tsp of maple syrup for each strip of bacon.

name: Waffle Peach Topping
directions: Put 1/2 cup of sugar into sauce pan.
Put 2 heaping Tsp. of corn starch into sugar.
Drain peaches into mixture.
Add 1/2 cup of cold water into mix.
Mix mixture.
Cook until thickens, stirring constantly.
Add chopped peaches.
Add 1 tsp. of butter.
To top it off, add a sprinkle of nutmeg.
notes:
*May need to add more liquid after adding chopped peaches.
*Delicious on waffles!

name: Waffles
directions: Mix all dry ingredients together in a large mixing bowl.
Mix milk, eggs, and oil in a separate bowl.
Add milk, eggs, and oil mixture to dry ingredients.
Mix well.

name: Wassail
directions: Boil water and sugar until dissolved.
Add all spices, cover and let stand 1 hour
Add juices.
(Optional: Add 1 cup orange juice.)
notes: ***Serve hot or cold.

name: Watermelon Banana Smoothie
directions: Blend all ingredients together until smooth.
Either chill, drink, or make Popsicles with the smoothie mixture.
notes: Go easy on the yogurt, especially if you're using Greek yogurt.

name: Watermelon Salsa
directions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Serve with chips.
notes: 1 jalapeno, minced and optional

name: Watermelon Sorbet
ingredients: 1 (2-pound) piece seedless watermelon, rind removed and flesh cut into 1-inch pieces to yield about 3 1/2 cups
1/3 cup fresh lime juice (from about 3 large limes)
directions: In a blender, blend the watermelon, pineapple juice, ginger ale, lime juice, and grenadine until smooth. Pour into an ice cream maker and freeze, according to the manufacturer's instructions, for about 35 minutes.
Spoon into glasses or small bowls and serve.

name: Whipped Cream
directions: Place all ingredients in a mixing bowl or electric mixer and whisk until medium peeks.

name: White Chicken Chili
ingredients: 2 Jars Pace picante (16 oz per jar)
directions: Put all ingredients into crock-pot for 4-6 hours.
Once it's finished cooking (6-8 hours on low), shred the chicken and add cheese.
notes: 4 hours on high or 6+ hours on low.

name: Whole Wheat Bread
ingredients: 10-13 cups flour depending on the altitude
directions: Mix all ingredients together having the mixer on while adding cups of flour.
Let dough rise with lid unlatched.
Shape into loaves (4).
Grease pans with Crisco. Sprinkle flour in pan.
Let rise until double in size.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Bake for 35 minutes.

name: Zucchini Fries Dipping Sauce - Arrabiata Sauce
directions: In a medium saucepan, warm the olive oil and cloves of garlic over medium heat. Cook the garlic until fragrant and lightly brown, about 4 minutes, moving occasionally.
Remove and discard the garlic. Add the chopped garlic to the pan and cook gently until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes and cook for about 10 minutes over medium heat to reduce.
Remove from heat and stir in chopped basil leaves; adjust seasoning accordingly with salt.
